Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JAMZTOWN
Reviews.Content: The best part was the breakfast buffet, but that got boring after 3 days. Room was tiny, I was travelling alone so it was enough but it would've been a tight squeeze for two. Hard to find and construction and traffic made sleeping difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherry315
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank all the staff at the Ipek Palas. My friend and I booked a double room for 3 nights and loved the fact that we were so close to all the cultural tours and places. We had no problems travelling around on the trams I would like to say a special thank-you to Ramazan who runs the Terrace Restaurant. It provides friendly service and good food. I even had a special red silk tablecloth and the most beautiful shaped knapkins especially twisted into flowers plus a fabulous cake and sparklers to celebrate my birthday. Very thoughtful and very kind. Room was a bit small but very clean and there was a safe in the wardrobe.

Reviews.Title: “A star just for location”
Reviews.Author: michster54
Reviews.Content: I would have rated this hotel a 3 / 5 but added another star just for the great location. Its within a 10 minute walk to the Topaki Palace, Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque and less than 5 minutes to the Sirkeci tram stop. Hotel itself was just OK -- we booked a "superior" room but it was still pretty small and had a weird smell to it. Overall room was clean but definitely an old room, with old furniture, and the bathroom had a TINY shower (with one of those on-the-wall soap-and-shampoo-in-one dispensers). We faced a side street so didn't have problems with noise that other reviewers complained about; but they were doing some interior construction/remodelling/painting of the hallways outside our room which made it impossible to sleep in late. Staff was polite, friendly and helpful. Breakfast wasn't amazing but there was a decent spread. Overall we didn't love the hotel but for the cheap rate and great location we were satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Judith B
Reviews.Content: Superb location in the centre of the historical area. Apparently it is the 2nd oldest hotel in Istanbul. Breakfast as expected, rooms a bit of a disappointment, although the staff did move us and we were very happy with the second room. The staff are superb, very friendly and helpful. The construction of a new underground train line is a bit noisy at night if you are in one of the front rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the constructions site next door”
Reviews.Author: GrahamSChelmsford
Reviews.Content: We have just returnd from a 4 day stay at the Ipek Palace visiting with friends. The hotel is excellent for position in the old town and in walking distance to most of the attactions. The staff in the hotel were extremely pleasant and tried to be very helpful. Breakfast was relatively basic, but expected, no complaints really. Our room was not like that shown on the website and was probablty the smallest room we have ever stayed in, room 307. It was obviously a single room at one time with a double bed squeezed against the wall. Not enough hanging space meant most of our clothes were kept in the case. What really spoilt the trip though was the major construction site next door. Our room overlooked this directly. On arrival the hotel was full and they did not have any other rooms available to move any of our party to. The noise was immence and throughout the night every night, with no let up. I am sure when the work is complete the hotel will be better but for the time being we could definatley not reccomend staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DavidFethiye
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second visit to Istanbul, and my second stay at The Hotel Ipek Palas. As one would expect, Istanbul has not changed, nor has this hotel, well, only a little. The hotel is situated in the very heart of the Old City, and really cannot be beaten for value. The rooms are a good size and very comfortable, and there are both TV and Internet for those who desire such things. There is also a lift to all floors, and from the top floor, just a few extra steps to the roof restaurant, which affords fantastic views over the Bosporus Sea. The staff are quite wonderful: very welcoming and very helpful. There is also a small but quite well stocked bar. The hotel is within a few minutes' walk of so many of Istanbul's attractions, and its winter prices make it superb value for money. So, how has the hotel changed since last year? Well, the breakfasts are bigger and better than ever - quite unbelieveable! And this year they have a lady who checks daily with all the guests to make sure all is well for them. What an excellent idea. Many an English hotel could learn a thing or two from The Hotel Ipek Palace. The one slight problem for some people may be that building work is taking place in the area, where a new Metro Station is being constructed. At times, there may be some noise. However, the staff do all they can to change rooms if people are affected by this. I can thoroughly recommend this very splendid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: lynda g
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the real star of our few days in the city. The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful especially Ruvenda at the customer relations desk and Ramazan the head waiter. We ate at the rooftop restaurant three nights out of the five because of it`s view and the lovely atmosphere and great food. The customer relation desk was a new experience for us and Ruvenda knew everything about everything and what she didn`t immediately know she soon found out! We were also so pleased with the hotel`s central situation and character. All in all a great find and we look forward to returning when we can.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hotel is a Palace”
Reviews.Author: MALCOM P
Reviews.Content: Very Good Hotel to stay in Central of Istanbul, Very clean and all staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sola250
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in Jan 12 and it was really good , the location is fantastic very close to all the attractions , few minutes to blue mosque and grand bazzar, easy to find a good and cheap restaurants near by , super clean , the breakfast is ok , very welcoming and helpful staff , the room is big enough and with nice shower , highly recommended .

Reviews.Title: “Basic but central.”
Reviews.Author: HonorOak2
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with our room at this hotel felt more like staying in a hostel. Rooms on web looked good. Booked double room but were supposedly upgraded to superior room and given a twin. bathroom very simple withe tiniest sink. Tv tiny boxset, nothing in minibar. too many stairs/steps to get to room. not accessible. breakfast quite basic. Separated from main hotel in next door building. Dont bother with this hotel felt like we'd been given cheap seats and been duped by staff. glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyM98
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely four nights in the Ipek Palas hotel. We always knew the staff were there to help us if we needed it, especially Miss Ruveyda Demirci, the guest relations manager who was always on hand to provide help and assistance. The hotel is in an excellent location, within easy walking distance of the main sites. We found the hotel restaurant excellent - very reasonably priced, with a beautiful sea view. The food was freshly prepared and very tasty, and the restaurant staff very helpful. The breakfasts were very filling, with a wide choice, they set us up for the day. Many thanks to everyone at the hotel for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Danny H
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a three day stay at The Ipek Palas.The hotel was very clean , and the breakfast was good. The staff are very pleasant , especially Suleyman the porter , whom was always friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in central Istanbul , close to all the sights and flavours of the city.

Reviews.Title: “my parents visit in feb 12”
Reviews.Author: liaqat
Reviews.Content: My parents travelled on the 22nd feb 12- 26th feb, they stayed at the ipek palas, this was their first real holiday abraod and the staff and the hotel where very very helpfull, room was spacious and clean and hotel was amazing, my parents came back with a huge smile , they raved about the breakfast and facilities and the hospitality that was shown.

Reviews.Title: “satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Huda G
Reviews.Content: It was a good choice, close to every where, clean, everything i needed was there, 24 hours service, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: massie_le
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a lastminute.com secret hotel deal and upgraded from economy room before we went as a result of reading reviews here. Hotel location wise was great. Rooms themselves a bit drab. It's certainly not 4 star UK quality, more 3 star in my opinion. Free wifi worked well but TV lost signal at times. Rooms were very warm and had to sleep with window open which meant a nice wake up call at 6am from the local mosque. Breakfast was ok, a bit of a selection. I recommend this hotel if you are planning on a lot of sightseeing and only need somewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money....great location”
Reviews.Author: aysha1987
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, however before i booked my holiday my decision making was solely based on reviews i had read on TripAdvisor therefore i felt it was only fair to share my experience with you!! On arrival we used the metro from the airport to reach the hotel, it cost us 4 lira per person which is like Â£1.50!! Much cheaper than shuttle bus/ taxi etc and really easy to use. There is usually a guard at every station so i pointed at the stop we wanted to reach and he would point the direction of the platform! When we arrived it was tricky to find the hotel as it is on a back street and not many people around could speak english. We managed eventually to find the hotel, the front view you see of the hotel is actually not the view you would see as you approach the hotel (you see the side view because it is located on a street corner) so that is why we didn't realise where it was. Eventually we found it and it is like 2 minutes from the metro stop which we found convenient later. I booked our holiday via lastminute.com including flights so to be fair we didnt pay a huge amount for the time we stayed, however on booking i did pay around Â£40 extra to upgrade to a 'superior double' which i would say is a standard (on the small side) double bedroom. Reading other reviews before i booked was the reason i paid more. We were on the 4th floor, and it was peacefully quiet. Our room was cleaned everyday, sheets changed daily, bathroom was clean, fresh towels daily. We had one cupboard which you could probably hang around 5-6 items in, a old style box tv (mostly turkish channels but there was mtv/bbc news/ al jazeera, nothing amazing) a dressing table/bedside table and a very large arm chair and still enough space to move around. The bed was not massive but it was fine for a couple. I did not find the mattress comfortable but my husband did not have any sleeping problems. We had a bath and shower and the bathroom was a comfortable size. Also it was snowing while we stayed there and i think there is under floor heating because the floors were always very warm which was perfect after we had walked in the snow all day!! There is a massive construction site right behind the hotel, we could see this from our window view and there are people working on it day and night. We could not hear any noise however unless the window was open. I think the windows were double glazed. There is also a mosque behind the hotel and we did hear the call for prayer at sunrise however there are many mosques in istanbul and i believe this would be the case in any other hotel too. It did not bother us that we could hear it. Breakfast was like a buffet, from 7-10.30, there is quite a variety of food available (cereal, bread, olives cheese etc) no fresh juice but they do have a juice machine that has like 8 different flavours (apple orange etc) Wifi was ok, we did have some nights where it would not work or disconnect frequently, but mostly it worked fine. It took us about 5 - 7 minutes to walk to Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The hotel is also about 5 mins from the Sea where you can take ferry trips around the city. The side road from the hotel leads directly to the Spice Bazaar ( Misir Carsisi) in about 5 minutes also. The Grand bazaar is a little longer to walk however still within walking distance. We walked everywhere even in the evening late at night and we never felt unsafe. Local people are so friendly and they will try to help you if you are lost. The inner roads are lined with local take aways/resturants so you have a good choice of food if you dont want to eat at the hotel resturaunt. The food in Turkey is amazing and it is not expensive if you eat locally. There was also macdonalds/ burger king/ dominos pizza really close if you dont want turkish food. On returning, we did book a shuttle bus from the hotel to the airport which only cost us 20 lira (roughly Â£7.50) per person which picked us up on time and dropped us to the airport in about 30 minutes. It did stop to collect another passenger but they literally stopped for a minute to load the luggage and off we went. Overall, i think in turkey a 4* / 5* rating is not the same as it is in europe, however for the prices paid i think it was good value for money. Don't rely on star ratings go by reviews. There are so many hotels around 'Old Istanbul' because that is where all the sites are, and the roads are really small and crowded with shops as it is a really old city. But is is all part of the charm of the city. If you are going to visit Istanbul for luxury, then the old town is not for you, if you want to see all the historical sites then it is perfect. For us it was perfect as we just wanted somewhere to dump our stuff and sleep, and visit all the sites. We were out and about mostly and being in the location that we were, it was easy to take the metro across the river to the new city to see Taksim Square etc plus within walking distances of everything we needed to see in the Old city. Overall, it was good value for the money we paid, its a nice clean hotel presented well, we never had any problems with anything in our room. Not all the staff can speak english however there was usually one person at the main desk who could communicate with us perfectly in english at all times. Hope this was helpful!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked through lastminute.com and on the whole our stay at Ipek Palas was lovely. The location was fantastic and within walking distance of many of the main tourist attractions. We were extremely well looked after by the staff, in particular Ruveyda, the customer relations manager. She was a great representative of the hotel and people in Istanbul. She was really warm and friendly and went out of her way to help us. I feel she genuinely cares for her guests. I feel we were slightly let down by lastminute.com with the choice of room included in the package. I would advise traveling couples to steer clear of the "economy double" as this was small even for a single room and the bed was tiny. However, Ruveyda saw to it that we were moved to one of the larger double rooms which was closer to what we were expecting. I would recommend Hotel Ipek Palas to holiday makers in the future, but just ensure you know which room you will be staying in before you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Gilsonbarboza
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near at main attractions and tourist points . All Staff are very professional and provided good attention for guests , specially person responsible for Guest Relations . The room for 04 persons with good space . The only bad point are the civil works near of hotel that have long working period until closed 22 hs . So , during this period bring some extra noise . Despite this , I recomend this hotel for other persons .

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fays123
Reviews.Content: I choose those hotel as a package deal from lastminute it was cheap but the quality of the room and view outside was poor it was like a construction site when i looked out our window the view was of a construction site. the size of the basic room was poor i tried to pay extra to get room upgraded but staff said they had nothing else available. on the plus side they offered buffet breakfast which was good and location was excellent within working distance of all the usual sites. I would not recommend anyone going to this hotel even if they upgrade there room.

Reviews.Title: “a little eccentric”
Reviews.Author: russelld49
Reviews.Content: a very pleasant hotel in a great location - nice rooms, friendly staff, good breakfasts. All round good value. There is a building site next door but didn't hear much noise, room was triple glazed. The hotel can be a little eccentric; had a minibar but no glasses in room or bathroom, tea bags/coffee was rationed, when asked for more on day 2 told only available first night (we were staying 4 nights) and shower was minute, could hardly get in and had to stand, even though bathroom could have had bigger shower. Would recommend and revisit ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Choppercopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed first week on January. Arrived to a warm welcome with great directions from the tram stop. The room was small although we had upgraded it had an extra single bed in which made it cramped. Avoid if you can the ground floor rooms as it was noisy for me with passing foot traffic. Breakfast was very nicely layed out with a wide variety to suit all. The location of the Ipex is a great with all the main historical sites within walking distance or a short tram..A great start to discover Instanbul

Reviews.Title: “Verblijf in Pera Palas”
Reviews.Author: BahtiyarK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ipek Palas hotel in 2009 (6 days). This year I returned once again (January). The rooms are cleaned every day. The staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served by means of a buffet with a rich variety of cereals, yoghurt, cheese, olives, salads, sandwiches, omelets, and all kinds of Turkish dishes. Miss Ruveyda Demirci (Guest Relations), a friendly and helpful staff employee, was walking around asking people whether everything was alright. When needed she provided guests with all kinds of tips en tricks. An advantage of the Ipek Palas Hotel in Sirkeci is the vicinity of the tram, ferries and the various touristic highlights. I definitely would recommend this hotel. There are some construction works in the neighbourhood, however, but it didn't really hinder me a lot, since I fell asleep rather quick, tired after wandering through Istanbul....

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place I will stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TerrysTravelTales
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently visited Istanbul for the first time. We have traveled quite a bit and I cannot think of a time when we were better taken care of while staying at a hotel. All the staff, from the reception desk to the restaurant, were friendly and accommodating, but their guest relations manager [Ruveyda] went above and beyond for us. We never really book tours or the like, however, for this trip it was recommended to get assistance when planning a visit to Cappadocia(a MUST DO if you go to Turkey). Ruveyda helped us every step of the way, with a smile! She even checked in on us during our days away from their hotel to make sure we arrived safe in Cappadocia! I could go on, but I too am an avid trip advisor consulter and would not want anyone to think this was too good to be true. If you stay anywhere near the historic district of Sultanahmet or Sirkeci, stay here--you will not be disappointed! OH yeah, and its a great value to boot and within walking distance to the major historic sites on the west side of the Galata Bridge!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel at Very Good Locality of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SHAMUNDLC
Reviews.Content: I had 3 night stay at Hotel Ipek Palas. It was a nice hotel. More than the amenities of this hotel I really liked the attention and courtesy of the staffs of this hotel, especially that of customer relationship manager Ms. Ruveyda. She is a real asset for this hotel. Also, the staff at reception were very attentive and courteous. I will definitely prefer this hotel in Istanbul and recommend my friends and colleagues. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: GiorgosAthens2012
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Ipek Palas very much. All staff was very friendly, smiling and professional. Istanbul is very friendly in terms of walking around and transportation, and the hotel is well located at the city center. I'm in love with the city, for me the hotel premises were comfortable enough. And it is a CLEAN place. And warm. There is a computer at the lobby with free internet access, and a free wifi network is available there.Staff was helpful at all times, very much reflecting the country's friendly manner. Thank you! Greetings from Athens, Greece.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mohammed zahir R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent me and my wife stayed during the end of november and the service was great! The staff were very well spoken and extremly helpfull with usefull information and were always ready to help , the room was imaculate and the location is ideal being walking distance from all the major sites and the tram and also the pier. I will almost certainly be coming again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: CUXMAX
Reviews.Content: It was the second time that we have been at Ipec Palace and since the last year there have been some changes. Staff has been very helpful and since the last time everybody has been friendly and customer oriented. They implemented the position of a Guest Relation Manager who has been always available with some good and helpful information concerning tours, pharmacies and things to see. Good improvement, well done. During the busy days the breakfast staff needs a little improvement as the quality does after New Year the breakfast quality was ok. All in all a perfect and great vacation. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time here!”
Reviews.Author: NN12345
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time in Istanbul and can really recommend the Hotel Ipek Palas. Everyone is always friendly and helpful with organizing trips or getting around. Never annoying. Everything is nice and clean. There are a lot of different rooms, some very small but nice, others big and spacious. The breakfast was a great buffet. Upstairs they have a nice restaurant with a view of Istanbul. And the location is convenient with only a short walk to the Blue Mosque, the Palast or the Grand Basar. Free Internet. For us they made it an extraordinery stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: englishgirlabr0ad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days between Xmas and NY and it was a late deal. First impression of the room was a little disappointing, not as small as I expected from other reviews but a little shabby. However overall the stay was great. The room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom ok and staff were helpful. The breakfast was more than adequate with lots of choice although they couldn't cope with the demand. Everything ran out by the time went down at 9am including cups and the hot food. And they didn't have enough staff. It did improve however the next day. Overall it was a good value hotel and perfect location for all the main sights. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Asha N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ipek Palace hotel over christmas in 2011. We were very happy with their service. Their moto seemed -Service with a smile. Our special thanks to Idris and Ruyveda. The hotel is in a nice location for all tourist attractions. Would recommend the hotel to our friends. Mrs Asha Nair, UK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and location”
Reviews.Author: Aliah W
Reviews.Content: We booked with lastminute and we were really pleased with the location of the hotel as we were walking distance to all the main tourist spots and with very good access to the tram and ferry ports. We spent 4 nights at the Ipek Palas and the highlights of the hotel are the friendly and helpful members of staff, the efficient cleaning of rooms and the standards of service at Breakfast. The Lobby staff were always ready to give advice and suggestions which always came with a smile. Special Thanks to Aladdin and Ruveyda for all your help. The rooms are well maintained and the beds are comfortable. A lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, Excellent Staff...great location.”
Reviews.Author: HERNAN-ANGEL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for pleasure purposes and it was a great option, close to all mayor historical places, clean, modern, reliable and EXCELLENT staff...Since you walk in to check in, the Concierge Ruveida Demircy welcomes you with a warm welcome, Turkish tea and explains it all to make the trip unforgettable. I recommend the breakfast buffet and tours offers. Definately a great experience !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sravya
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through lastminute.com. It was difficult to spot and we were sent in circles to find the place - but when finally did spot it, staff were very friendly. Room was nice and clean and themed on local village. Breakfast had wide variety of choice. Staff were extremely helpful in giving directions and suggestions. Hotel itself is very accessible to various sighseeing locations including Spice Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, etc

Reviews.Title: “Really good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hosseinmor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from Nov 30 to Dec 5. every thing was excellent. room was clean, good breakfast and of course very very nice staffs who really cares us with their hospitality. specially Ms. Ruveyda Demirci ( Guest Relations) who was really such a jewellery for me and all other guests. the other point about this hotel is its location which allow you to go everywhere on foot or by tram. ( in Istanbul taxi is expensive). I strongly recommend this hotel to every body.

Reviews.Title: “Station being built next door!!! Watch out!!”
Reviews.Author: Avb1990
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous comments the photos on the websites do not match what is here!!! This hotel suffers from a case of over flashy front and entrance but does not have any substance to back it up. But to start with a positive it is very well located for all the attractions in the old city, only a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Archaeology museum, Topkapi Palace, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern and Grand bazaar to name a few. But after that there aren't many positives. The rooms are very small and hot, the heating is on full. We request serveral times for it to be turned down, without any luck, we have ended up having the A/C on cold to try and combat t. As having the windows open is just not an option. This is because of the new railway tunnel they Are building next door. They appear to only work during the night with hundreds of lorrys comeing and going and the constant noise of a JCB digger!! It was almost impossible to sleep with the noise and the heat!! The bath rooms where clean but small, it was impossible to turn in the shower without hitting yourself!! The breakfast was on the lower side of average, with a take on the continental breakfast. Before staying here I would check if the building work has finish, but that looks like it could be several years!! So I would look elsewhere to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great value - great location”
Reviews.Author: adelaide m
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, nice linens, good breakfast, good water pressure, nice staff Amazing location for visiting the tourist sites. A little far away from the party spots but it is easy to hop in a cab and head to the bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Charlottelaura1
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on lastminute.com but was a bit apprehensive about the room size as had read reviews saying they were too small, but had nothing to worry about. We were greeted upon arrival warmly and with a welcome drink. Our room was fine- clean, comfortable, with a good size bathroom. The location is amazing, walking distance to the sights such as blue mosque, hagia sofia, basilica cistern,grand bazaar etc. We didn't eat in the restaurant except for breakfast which was a standard buffet, perfectly nice. Overall a great stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Turkish hospitality at an excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: obaysan
Reviews.Content: Location - perfect! 10minutes walking distance from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace...at a stone's throw from Eminonu..but yet on a quiet street! Hospitality - perfect! True Turkish hospitality shown from the moment you walk through the door. Ambiance - perfect! Internal decoration is a reflection of Istanbul civilisations...Loved the "last Ottoman supper of Christ" picture in the dining room where open buffet Turkish breakfast is served. Received great advice and recommendations in planning the 48hours we had in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best price in the area, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Dragoslav L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at IPEK from Sep. 24, 2011 to Oct. 02, 2011 and were satisfied with room, breakfast, extremly friendly staff and location. The location is great for anyone who visits Istanbul as tourist and wants to see major churches, mosques and other points of interest. Our room was the corner room, one floor above the street level and it was not noisy. It was spacious, clean and perfectly maintained during our stay. Breakfast is excellent, featuring turkish and european morning dishes. The staff is extremly helpful and always with a smile! We arrived by air and used IPEK's airport to hotel and hotel to airport transportation. We recommend this transporatation, because the hotel is hidden in small street and taxi drivers may have difficulties to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff... perfect location.. awesome rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: Ankur C
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night stay over at Ipek Palas and I must say I am very pleased by the experience whether the food on offer or the service, its great. The reception desk is extremely helpful, a special thanks to Ruveyda for putting up with my super broken turkish! The location is great and only a stones throw away from the port for the bosphorous cruise, the tram and also some of the historic sites in sultanhment. I would say the only downside was the size of the room which I found slightly small but again in old town istanbul thats what you get besides that everything was up to mark. The rooftop restaurant is a great place to chill in te nights with a surreal view..Thanks guys for a great stay and I will definitely come back on my nxt holiday to istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Sara54parker
Reviews.Content: It was alovely hotel in the old city.very reasonable price for this quality thanks for your good hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: WaMos
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Istanbul for nine days this fall, where we lived at Hotel Ipek Palas. We could not have chosen a better place to stay. The staff is extremely friendly and guided us at all times. A special thanks to Ruveyda and Ramazan for your kind nature. We would at all times return to Istanbul, and of course stay at Ipek Palas. The location was very good, as we could walk to every big attraction in the city. Not one time were we in need of a taxi. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to take a trip to the center of Istanbul and be able to both do a lot shopping and at the same time experience the historical places in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Istanbul at the charming Ipek Palas!”
Reviews.Author: arpagirl
Reviews.Content: Adele (43) from Salerno, Italy I've recently got back from Istanbul after a 7 nights stay at the Ipek Palas. My warmest 'thank you' goes to all the staff that has made the difference and let me me feel completely at ease in a city I've visited for the first time and certainly not the last. Being on my own I was a little concerned whilst, as a matter of fact, I enjoyed evertyhing at hotel, my cozy room facing the alleys of the city center (location perfect!), the friendliness and the competence of the staff, the delicious Turkish food both at breakfast and dinner and service in general was excellent, immagine that the night porter, very early in the morning (03.30am), made me even use his personal mobile telephone without letting me pay! A special mention goes to Ruveyda, the guest relation manager, whose smile alone was enough to wish you a good day! The beauty of the city as well as of the people made my trip one of the most enjoable ones! The hotel also offers a variety of excursions as well as transfer services worth a try! I'll certainly get back to the Ipek Palace next time!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel got a superior Location”
Reviews.Author: AhmedAdel25
Reviews.Content: first of all the staff were so friendly, food was great and of course the hotel location is amazing. the location is the old city near to topkapi. however the room was not good enough ... was not spacious family room ... the mattress was disaster because it was making a noise while you moving .. although i advised the management to change it but no one responds. overall ... other than the mattress it was lovely time i have spent in the Ipek Palas Hotel. as i said the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Amir S
Reviews.Content: To be honest on first seeing the hotel and the price I paid for it I was not expecting much. However I was more than pleasantly surprised. The best thing about this hotel was by far the staff, who all truly love working there and are extremely helpful, just to name a few names: 1) Murad - Excellent service at desk, He is the man who know how to get things and a good sense of humour too. 2) Alauddin - Also very friendly and helpful and professional 3) Umid - Bellboy, very friendly, helpful, polite, I even gave him a hug on leaving! 4) Ruweydah - I never met anyone who smiles so much and means it! Genuinely enjoys her job and goes out of her way in making it a comfortable stay . The hotel is literally 5-10 minute walk away from the spice bazar, a stones throw from the bosphorous, 10 minute walk to Sultan Ahmet and close to tram stations. I almost feel I shouldn't be telling you all this, as it might me difficult for me to get a room next time! Overall very good value for money in terms of location and atmosphere and free wi fi too!

Reviews.Title: “'Ipek' for a silky smooth vacation”
Reviews.Author: eagertripmaker
Reviews.Content: As the name suggests, the service in Ipek (silk in Turkish) is sans any rough edges. We stayed at the Ipek Palas during our stay in Istanbul in October '11 and there was not a moment of regret about the choice of stay. It is centrally located and all the places of interest are walking distance from the hotel. For the laid back traveller the tram station is just a few furlongs away. The hotel staff especially the front desk team were extremely friendly and warm that it made us feel at home. They recommended the best places to see, shop and have a great time in Instanbul. The hotel is very clean and is value for money. Higly recommended for students, families especially for couples with toddlers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: holidayfun123
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked a four night stay in a superior room through Lastminute.com. We were very happy with the hotel - it is perfectly located near the tram, ferry and all the major sights. The room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was adequate with a wide choice of dishes. But.......there was a snag with our room when we checked in. We were given a pokey back room with a narrow 'double bed' and hardly enough room to move around, which looked out onto a narrow air vent, definitely NOT a superior room which we had paid extra for. The manager explained that this was their superior room, but we were not happy, so he promised to move us to a bigger room with a bigger bed the next day. The next day we were moved to a much better & bigger room, 111 and we were very happy after that. We would stay there again, but one needs to make sure that you get the room that you paid for. During our stay, I overheard guests on two different occasions complaining about the size of the rooms and begging to change or up grade, so be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, central location, Helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: nicola h
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a 'secret hotel' and was really pleased with it. We where greeted by the friendly and helpful Ruveyda the guest relations. We where in the economy room and although small (it looked exactly like the one in their website photo)it was really clean and comfortable. Breakfast is plentiful and tasty. Good transport links. On the last day we missed our flight and the hotel gave us a good deal to stay the extra night. I would happily stay again when coming back to Istanbul. A couple of tips go to the Home Made cafe around the corner- lovely turkish food and if you coming from Sabien Gocken airport get the E10 express bus to the ferry then get boat to Eminonu stop and the hotel is just a short walk away- the whole trip cost TL7!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting building site next door, but amazing views and service.”
Reviews.Author: EnglishPurpleturtle
Reviews.Content: After initially being squashed into a small room, we requested to change which was accommodated without question. Isme was fantastic at recommending activities and eateries. Istanbul has a lot to offer, and so does ipek palas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elena S
Reviews.Content: During our stay we had no problems as the staff was very friendly and trying always to fulfill our needs or to help if we were in doubt. Especially Idris who was very polite with us. Very nice and clean rooms, good pricing, perfect for anyone seeking for a place to relax after a long day visiting or shopping around. It's as well quite close to many attractions of Istanbul. All in all if you're still undecided whether to choose this hotel or not should make up your mind fast because you'll lose your chance fast!!

Reviews.Title: “Wildswan 600 great Hotel, fantastic staff, immaculate”
Reviews.Author: wildswan600
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful holiday in Istanbul. Excellent Hotel but do not have an economy room as the double is a small single in reallity so best to upgrade! Spotlessly clean hotel with very friendly staff who always had a smile, especially Ruveyda.. Do try the hotel restaurant which serves lovely food on the top floor overlooking the Bosphorus - really romantic and sadly not used enough. The position of the hotel is ideal for walking to all the major attractions and a very good restaurant along the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Well Priced, Brilliant and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Callum1892
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay, we came as a group and got a good deal. 24hour very friendly reception staff (Murat, Idris, Ruveyda, Umit, Alaedin, Mustafa Bellboy), cleaning staff and catering were also brilliant. Makes a real change when people do everything with a genuine smile. No negative comments, any minor problems were always dealt with promptly. Really appreciated the late night support from Murat and team and the early morning cheer from Ruveyda and Alaedin. Breakfast wasn't bad either! Would definitely return again and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with very helpful staff and good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: plauris
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff in this centrally located hotel which is within easy walking distance of all the main sites. Rooms are on the small side but do have an air conditioning unit which is welcome. Large breakfast selection which will keep you going well past lunch time. Not a European 4 star hotel - but don't be put off by that it is great value for money, and who wants to spend a large amount of time in their room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “located in the heart of istanbul, very confortable and clean one & the stuff are very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nidal L
Reviews.Content: Apart from its location close to most of the famous city's landmarks (topkapi, aya sophia, bleu mosque, hippodrome, grand bazar...), the hotel has very clean rooms & confortable ones, with a great view of marmara sea. the stuff are very friendly & heplfull too. The hotel offers some very interesting discounts, yu can check their offers in their website. As for the local cuisine, you wont complain, its very yummy. and you can have large choice around the hotel for cafÃ©s & restaurants. If i have a chance to go back to Istanbul i'll definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maria H
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. You easily walk to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and other high lights in the old town. It is also close to the tram which take you to the new city and Taksim square in a short time. The service is good. The breakfast ok but simple. We stayed for seven days, and after a few days we got pretty tired of it. More variety would have been preferred. The room was VERY small. The bed is 140 cm. They are cleaned and nice, but a bit old. This is not a 4-star hotel. But a very praiseworthy oneâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Nice, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: eneacsu
Reviews.Content: Very close to St Sofia Church but also close to a functioning mosque (every morning a guy woke me up at 5 yelling...). Nice view for restaurant, you can see Bosphorus from there. Good breakfast. Rather big rooms, the elevator is rather old. The parking lot is with pay... The main advantage is the location, you can walk to St Sofia and other interesting places in old town but also you can take tram to other places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, clean rooms, and a few negatives.”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelDoYou
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better. Walking distance from the Bosphorus, Ayasofia, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, etc. We never took a taxi anywhere, we just walked. Great location. However, the construction site just outside our room (they are building a tunnel under the Bosphorus) was very loud on our last night. They continued until about 12:30AM and for some it would have been impossible to sleep. I live in a city so shutting it out was not a problem. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a typical Turkish buffet with a variety of salads, yogurt, bread, olives, soup, etc. The fruit juices were flavored water, literally. Real fresh squeezed orange juice was an additional 5 TL. The WiFi connection was excellent as the router was just outside our room. The rooms were very small, especially after seeing the misleading photos online. Not what we were expecting. We had a family suite (triple) with two rooms, but one air conditioner. Sometimes the main room was cold while other times it would not cool off. The second room would not cool off unless you ran the A/C all the time, even while you were out of the room. However, the maids turned off the A/C if you left it running while you were out. Also, common areas are not air conditioned. The bed was comfortable and we slept well every night. Also, with the exception of the carpet in the public areas, everything was very clean. The bathroom was very small. If you drop your soap, picking it up was a game. The only trash can in the suite was the small can in the bathroom. We had to recycle shopping bags as trash receptacles. Hot shower was good. The refrigerator, like in most hotels, did not keep anything very cold. Cool at best. I know this review sounds mostly negative, but we are flexible travelers and have learned to adapt. Our stay in Istanbul was not about the hotel, we stayed out most of the time. The restaurants around the hotel and the Lonely Planet recommended sweet shop are within a three minute walk. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. If you are looking for a big room go elsewhere. If you are looking for a GREAT location, this is the place. Overlook the minor annoyances and enjoy your stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Ipek..!!”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 13 - 20 August 2011. We were not looking for 5 * treatment otherwise we would have booked at a 5* Hotel. Our first room was not very big, so before we booked in we upgraded to a bigger room, (St Sophia Room). We were there to see Istanbul....!!!!! not live in our room for 7 days. The breakfast was good, just that if you got there after a 10h00 some of the foods were finished and they were not filling up again. (breakfast ended at 10h30) You get a kettle, cups...etc in your room, but you have to buy your own coffee, tea, milk sugar after the first day. The same with the bathroom soaps, shampoo....ect. ( I would advise the hotel to mention this to your guests before they book, some guests expect this to be replenished every day.) The A/C worked but did not cool down the whole room, so we slept with our windows wide open every night, listening to the sounds of the city.......& it was Rammadan. This hotel is close to everything you want to see......Yes, some of the staff don't speak or understand english that well, but were VERY friendly and helpful. Thanks for your friendly service & we wish you all the best. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Locationâ€¦ Overall a complete disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Z
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the Positive Notes firstâ€¦ The Hotel is conveniently located in the old part of Istanbul [Good Location to visit historic/touristic places], the rooms and bathrooms are clean, the Staff was friendly, and able to give touristic information about the city, the free Wi-Fi was not very reliable in one of our rooms but it was a good plus and the breakfast was just OK on the low-end sideâ€¦ I wish I would have read ALL the reviews (Good and Bad) in detail prior to booking this hotel. As highlighted before in other reviewsâ€¦ Please do not believe the 'photos' on the hotel's website and/or brochure, they are really so far from the truth, it's like a completely different hotel. The room that we were in (We booked 2 suites) were on the small side for a 2 bedroom suite. The air conditioning was not working properly (Only have A/C in one bedroom), The TV did not work, and regardless of our multiple complains the TV was never fixedâ€¦ So even though that the staff is friendly in summary the service is also very pour. They do not help you with anything, and it makes you feel that they donâ€™t care whether or not you have an enjoyable experience. The shower room was very tiny and could barely fit one person in it at a time. The restaurant is not as glamorous as they try to present it to you, nor is the hotel exterior. Please take my advice and just rethink before booking this hotel and to be honest if you want a decent hotel and pleasant stay I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheMilkMan2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the old part of Istanbul which we liked. Rooms were a bit small but clean and AC worked well. The breakfast was lovely and staff friendly. I would of preferred more facilities i.e swimming pool and bar but you need to pay a bit more in Isanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Ipek Palas Hotel. The room was spacious and very nice. The bathroom was clean. We could feel comfortable. The bathroom sets were also useful. The breakfast buffet was also very good. The staff were very helpful and kind. Apart from the good service and amenities, the location of the hotel is a big "+", as it is very close to all historical monuments ( Top KapÄ±, Sultanahmet, etc were only 10 min walk away), to tram station (2 min walk until Sirkeci tram station) and to EminÃ¶nÃ¼. The only "-" in our stay was the noise at night due to siteworks nearby. But with the windows closed it was much better. We will visit Istanbul again, so we will choose Ipek Palas for our stay once more. GÃ¶rÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼rÃ¼z!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: hotelmaster22
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is okay, but the rooms are very small for two adults. If you are two adults traveling, you may as well get the family room and the family room is too small for a family. The service is also terrible. They do not help you with anything, and could care less whether or not you have an enjoyable trip. Good luck with this place...I would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Txuzinho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice area full of restaurants and turistic spots. Clean, good beds, good breakfast and nice staff. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and close to most attractions”
Reviews.Author: ampek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance of Topkapi Place, Gulhane station and Park, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The rooms are not really big but I think the right size for this geography. If you donâ€™t need any fancy amenities this is a nice place to stay and the price is reasonable. The staff was very nice. I would definitely stay here again. If you book from their website you get a better deal, breakfast and one way airport pickup.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cameraguy15
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were well maintained with air con facility in all the rooms. The location was convenient to walk to the blue mosque and Aya Sofia. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jraja123
Reviews.Content: great location, 5 minutes tram journey to main attractions in sultanahmet, less than 10 minutes walk to central station, awesome free breakfast, really friendly staff, single room a bit small, very safe environment, shuttle to airport

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: arioso-11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ipek Palas is a small standard hotel in the district of Fatih on the historical peninsula surrounded by the Golden Horn, the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara; near trains, boats, the tram, historic sites, Taksim and the Galata bridge. What the hotel does not have in extravaganza and luxury, it certainly has in large portions of friendly service spiced with the famous Turkish hospitality. A haven to use when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “it was a pretty good experience”
Reviews.Author: sabeen30
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is its homely feel and excellent breakfast. that i lived. the rooms are small but well maintained. The staff especially the night time bell boy is too helpful and caring. I could easily let my child roam there without any hesitation. The location is ideal as Bhosperous sea and Grand Bazaar are at walking distance. The only problem we faced was the airconditioning breakdown, otherwise it was awesome. I would love to stay there again , it was like our home in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: mylife2315
Reviews.Content: If you think time and service is important, Ä°pek palas Hotel is a good choice.I stayed there with my family and we were in a family suit room.The design of the room and the service was wonderful.we stayed at Ä°pek Palas hotel 5 nights.Thanks to itâ€™s location, we visited many historical places easily.We were very close to the trainway station(Sirkeci).If your plane depars from AtatÃ¼rk Airport; you will have the chance to go there by tramway. Another thing which draws attention of me was the activities.When we went to eat something at restaurant, we were suprised because there was Whirling Dervish Show and it was free.You can order a fix menu for just 12 euros and everything was included that price. The hotel staff was very friendly.they were smiling everytime and their sincere behaviour towards us make us feel as if we were living in our home. We will go to Ä°stanbul again and our location will be Hotel Ä°pek Palas.thanks for everyhing:)

Reviews.Title: “Good location at the center of the Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: happylife26
Reviews.Content: I went to Ä°stanbul to attend my friendsâ€™ wedding ceremony.some of my friends who stayed at ipek palas hotel suggested to stay there.their suggestion was correct as they described it to me. The ceremony was in KadÄ±kÃ¶y and hotel ipek palas was 10 mÄ±nutes to take the boat to go to kadikÃ¶y.I would want to say that hotel ipek palas is really in a good position in terms of isâ€™ location, service and the staff.many of the historical places such as TopkapÄ± palace Hagia Sophia Blue mosque and Spicy bazaar takes 5 minutes by walking.In addition to it, the hotel has different types of activities about the culture of Turkey.From day to day, they bring belly dancers and dervishes at the top of the hotel.While I was eating my meal, I watched the activities and the show was free for the guests.All of the hotel staff was trying to do their best.they were dealing with every problem that I had.I would also mention about the breakfast.I didnâ€™t see so much variety even in 7 stars hotels. Thank for all of the things and the nice care of Hotel Ä°pek Palas.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate...at a push”
Reviews.Author: sparkles700
Reviews.Content: Word of warning before I start: do not believe the 'photos' on the hotel's website, they are so far from the truth, it's like a completely different hotel. The views from the hotel restaurant are not unspoilt and the economy room I stayed in is far more basic than it looks. The restaurant is not as glamorous, nor is the hotel exterior. This hotel is conveniently located in the old part of Istanbul. It is 5mins walk from the Blue mosque, Sofia mosque, Bosphorus (plenty of cheap boat trips - we got one for 20 lira (Â£7) for hour and half), shops and tram line. Unfortunately right next to the hotel is HUGE building works. They were working from 8am-2am, I was later informed that it is illegal to work to this time. The hotel staff never really seemed that bothered about it, saying they would finish working at 12pm which was never the case. Even though my room overlooked the works, I had a good window which blocked out most of the noise. Talking of noise, the walls between rooms are incredibly thin and you can hear other people's TVs and conversations, highly annoying when you are trying to get to sleep. The buffett breakfast was ok but small and only one or two choices changed daily, making it very boring after a while. We had dinner once in the restaurant, our meals we ordered all differed to what was on the menu and the waiter constantly tried to palm off a load a fruit for pudding that was obviously left over from their set menu that night as only us and another couple were dining there. We were also told by the Hotel Customer Relations guy that there would be a belly-dancing show which actually was one dancer for 15 mins. However, hotel staff were very friendly and helpful where they could be. The free wi-fi in the rooms made the experience less painful but to honest if you want a decent hotel i would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “why oh why response”
Reviews.Author: mae3410
Reviews.Content: Dear gulfem yasar ozberk, thanks for your response. Yes I agree we booked an economy room but that should have no impact what so ever on the service which we recieved. To be honest you have written this same response or something very similar on another bad review of Hotel Ipek Palas. It seems that they too must have ruined your AC system. I dididnt realise it was so complex to press an on and off button on a remote control. We were not the only guests to be complaining about the AC that night. Half our floor were out as they too were having the same problem. My husband and 4 other people went down to the hotel lobby to ask for this situation to be fixed and they were all very patient with your staff considering the circumstances. You have showen your true colurs to be honest, instead of trying to make amends and own up to your mistakes you are saying we owe you 500 euros. Trust me, you owe us a lot more for the terriable experience we had. All i can say is good luck for the future of your hotel as you most definitley need it.

Reviews.Title: “it was very nice.i am very pleased”
Reviews.Author: pao189400
Reviews.Content: i am very pleased of the hotel. very clean in very good posision the stuff very gently the breakfast very good. it was very nice near the tram all the monuments the big market the galata bridge the price very good. i am very sutisfied. the restaurant on the last floor very good with nice view

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dawar786
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in June. This was our first holiday as a family with our 1 and a half year old baby, so we wanted a hotel that was near all the major attractions in Istanbul. Ipek Palas did not disappoint. We were within 5 minutes walk from the harbour and the Spice Market, and about 10-15 minutes walk from Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, The Grand Bazaar, Cemberlitas Hammam and the rest of Sultanahmet. The tram station is just a few hundred yards away. The hotel is surrounded by wonderful restaurants including Hafiz Mustafa a specialist in Turkish sweetdishes. For those of you who like your junk food, McDonalds and Burger King are less than 5 minutes walk. The hotel rooms are clean and comfortable. Our room was a delight. The staff are very friendly. Aydin and Bilge are especially helpful. Emre is lovely. Ruveyda too. I could end up naming all of them if I knew their names. I would definitely visit Istanbul and this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I felt as if I am at home”
Reviews.Author: Nicolinan
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friends at Ä°pek Palas Hotel three nights and it was realy nice.There lots of reasons which makes Hotel Ä°pek Palas wonderfull.First of all, it is close to many historical places such as TopkapÄ± Palace, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque.Ä°t takes just 5 minutes to go to seaside(EminÃ¶nÃ¼).Spicy bazaar(mÄ±sÄ±r Ã§arÅŸÄ±sÄ±) and the Grand Bazaar, which are famous for shopping, takes ten minutes.Secondly, the Hotel ipek Palas symbolizes the tradition of old istanbul.Decoration of the rooms and the view from the terrace especially at nights gives the chance to taste the culture of Ä°stanbul.The staff of the hotel is very kind and helpful.there are two nices restaurants: the breakfast is open-bufffet.I am sure that they bring every food from all around the world:) and the music is very nice it makes me relax in the morning.Other restaurant is at 6 floor.I had the chance to see Bosphorous Bridge, Galata Tower and Hagia Sophia.There were fireworks at nights and it was really amazing from the terrace of the hotel.they make discount for their guests.I saw a different menu on my bed every day and the meals are really good at that price. thanks Ä°pek Palas and Ä°stanbul for everything...

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, could do with some improvement”
Reviews.Author: tanny_nau
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and was greeted by a staff who provided us with information regarding sightseeing in Istanbul. We were provided with a room which was not very spacious but okay I would say. We booked it as a mystery hotel in a famous site, so we kind of expected that since we got it in a deal it might not be the best rooms. The bathroom was clean but the shower was really tiny. The location is good. Its walking distance from Topkapi palace, Sophia Hagia, Blue mosque, Galata bridge and the port for Bosphoros cruise. Its near the Serkici Train station and near the tram line. That's a major plus point. The breakfast was good-had a good selecton of bread, jams, salamis, sausages, chesses and some hot dishes. They do have a restaurant at the top floor with some view of the Bosphorus and city, but we did not dine there. It was a little stuffy in June and tried keeping the window open at night, but it was a little noisy if u dont close your windows (We were on the 1st floor). so we closed the window and turned on the AC. Not sure if they have a swimming pool. dont think so. They do have a free computer to use on the ground floor and we can use the Wi-Fi using our laptop or phone.

Reviews.Title: “without aircon ,forgery hotel stuff”
Reviews.Author: barrowedheaven
Reviews.Content: we stayed at ipek palas hotel 2 nights without aircondition,in addition to this , hotel stuff advice us to open window feel fresh air ,.........during breakfast , hotel stuff using slang words to hotel customer in turkish .

Reviews.Title: “Very central, within walking distance of most of the famous places.”
Reviews.Author: billspin
Reviews.Content: Lovely helpful staff. A small well kept Hotel with a very good breakfast buffet. It is in the old town right next to a construction site which gives access to a new underground station. If you want a beautifully situated Hotel then the Ipek is not for you. However the old City with its Bazaar and historic buildings is not a pretty place but an interesting, historic and fascinating area. We loved it and loved walking safely to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Magic!! From start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: zaahira
Reviews.Content: If you going to Istanbul, stay at Ipek Palas. Its that simple. The staff of the hotel were helpfull and amazing! So beautiful and centrally located. Warm cosy and everything that my friends and I needed..and then some!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for limited budget”
Reviews.Author: Fran999
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly efficient staff, basic facilities, excellent breakfast, very reasonable; after initial problems we were accommodated in an upgraded room at no extra charge. Room and bathroom were adequate for a short stay. Staff were cooperative and able to give tourist information about city. Frances

Reviews.Title: “Do not take Economy rooms !”
Reviews.Author: Scottyrocket
Reviews.Content: Firstly I'd like to the staff I dealt with were courteous at all times and I have no problem with them at all. The rooms however are a totally different story. On arrival I was given room 508 and after opening the front door I immediately returned to reception to request another room, at which point I was told that the room I had was an economy room and that I'd have to keep it at least one night. The hotel is advertised on TripAdvisor as 4 star but the economy rooms are maybe 2 stars. There were a number of issues with this hotel such as a room so small I could not unpack my bags, a television screen smaller then my laptop computer, the toilet was not cleaned and there was a cigarette but in it, there was also a torn sheet. The next day I was moved into a slightly larger room that was at best satisfactory, but certainly not what booking.com advertised on their website. I definitely will not stay at this hotel again. Last time I was in Istanbul I stayed at Mamara Guesthouse for less $$ and found the experience far better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly - ideal for sightseeing old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Havetotravel46
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel in May 2011 for 3 nights. It was booked as a special discounted deal on a travel website. As expected, the room was rather small and basic in terms of furniture - but adequate for a long weekend, and the room and crisp bedlinen were VERY clean. Bathroom likewise was very clean. The recepionists and breakfast staff were helpful friendly and approachable. The breakfast consisted of a sufficiently wide choice of tasty items. We did not dine in the restaurant as there were so many delicous ones to choose from in the old city but both menus looked good in the hotel. We were on the 5th floor so directly below the restaurant - we did hear some noise but frankly were so tired from fabulous days out that we werent disturbed too much. Great location for the sights of old Istanbul - would recommend it, and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: ares005
Reviews.Content: First of all the room does not correspond AT ALL at the photos presented on the website, and when we asked confirmation that the room was indeed a "superior room", we were told to ask the director the day after. The room was in fact very small, although clean and very much in order. The room was very noisy and you can hear people just walking in the corridor. The service was average, the personnel not very pleasant but available to provide information etc. The location is quite good (very close to the central station and within walking distance to main attractions) although not in a very nice spot (the nearby buildings were all under renovation)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, near almost everything you want to see”
Reviews.Author: Lady2011Istanbul
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, in Sirecki, short distance to the most attractions. Nice hotel, good staff, good service, our room a bit small, good cleaning. We were satisfied. Should recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful and friendly staff, excelllent food and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Ogilvie
Reviews.Content: The staff here are so helpful and friendly I would never consider staying anywhere else in Istanbul. Very convenient for major attractions and really close to tram which is fast, frequent, cheap and pleasant to use. There is a stunning night time view across the Bosphorus and of the lit up mosques from rooftop restaurant and the food and service are very good. One of the best features is the guest services with a dedicated person to help you plan your day whether you want basic tourist information, ideas on restaurants, to talk about shopping or just to ask the name of something. Nothing is too much trouble. The bell boy even helped me use the Turkish keyboard to access my emails. The breakfast buffet had a very good selection to suit all tastes and I particularly liked the idea of free tea, coffee and cakes in the reception lounge area from 5 to 6 pm when guests sat around and relaxed before getting ready for the evening. I would strongly recommend this hotel to all tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Beks6
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that the staff at the Ipek Palas were really good. Helpful, friendly and approachable. Now for the not so good stuff....Firstly that reception area is deceiving - it looks opulent and pretty big but the rooms are tiny. We upgraded to what they refer to as superior rooms..there was hardly room to move. When we got to our room we thought there had been a mistake & we'd gotten an economy room but apparently those are even smaller. There's enough space for what they believe is a double bed, a small single wardrobe and a desk. The bathroom was big but not sparkling white like i expected - a bit worn. Bearing in mind I was going by standards of big chain cheaper hotels of the UK such as Ibis & Novotel, I was expecting space & power showers and all sorts seeing as Ipek is supposed to be a 4*. Anyway the first night was a bit of a nightmare. AC didn't work, phone didn't work so we kept having to go to reception & room service was late. The staff being as helpful as they were couldn't do much that night as it was late but they moved us to a new room the next day which had a smaller bathroom but the room lay out was a bit better. If it's views you're after then don't go to Ipek Palas & don't look out of your window if you are there. Also when you're outside the hotel it does look like you're in the dodgy back streets but don't be afraid - everyone was very pleasant & it is a bustling place so please be aware that people and animals & cars do happen to make noise at any time of the day & night. Best things about the hotel is it's within walking distance of Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the blue mosque and plenty of places to eat, the staff at the hotel are great and the food at the hotel is pretty good to0. They do have a pretty restaurant at the hotel on the top floor, the breakfast was a combo of strange things but for the most part not to bad. On our last night we requested an upgrade at an additional cost to one of their fancy rooms which was really nice & BIG! although bathroom tiny again. For convenience, location to everywhere else, staff & food I would go to Ipek again BUT because of the sizes of the rooms I would have to reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ROOMS AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: stevemale
Reviews.Content: I loved everything in this fantastic hotel very good quality in such a beatiful city very good service and rooms Thanks ...thanks to the staff and management

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Zuha_Shiil
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Ipek Palas for five nights in April, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is brilliant - the main historical sights are within a 10min walk, tram stop 5min and ferries around 8min. Staff are very welcoming, friendly and attentive. Buffet breakfast is honestly 5 star. I will definitely pick this hotel on a next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing birthday treat!”
Reviews.Author: Rodeoronnie
Reviews.Content: Our room was small with no hanging, storing or top space. There was a fridge and a kettle. At 5 everyday they served free tea (powder milk) and dry cake. The breakfast was above average continental. We had an odd array of sales items hanging in our room. Very strange. The vista was abysmal. The back of a dirty old building. There was only one English tv channel BBC world news! The wine waiter was rude and surly. The location was superb for all sightseeing, grand bazaar, the spice market, bosphorous, istanbul modern art gallery, blue mosque etc. I had asked for a special room as advertised in their brochure and though by email I was told I was getting one, we certainly didn't neither did we see these glamourous rooms whilst we were there. There was a restaurant with a view but we didn't try it. What made our stay was Taschin the concierge. He was helpful, happy, quietly assisting where necessary and the receptionist whose name I think was Olynz - sorry probably got that wrong, but lovely two guys. Keep up the good work. Oh there was one pc with free internet access also.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant hotel, well looked after, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: crods01
Reviews.Content: We got this at the last minute through LastMinute. It was comparatively cheap. In good condition, and has character. Enjoyed the buffet breakfast. Great location in Sultanahmet, close to tram. We had Economy rooms, which really were very small. Fine if you just want to use the room to dump your luggage and to sleep. Too cramped to comfortably hang out in. But why would you hang out in your hotel room when you are in the heart of wonderful Istanbul?!

Reviews.Title: “Buck up those box rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SUE90082
Reviews.Content: The main positive about the Ipek Palas is its ideal location for all sightseeing. It might take a day or two to familiarise yourself with the area, but once you have, you realise you are within walking distance of the two main mosques, the grand bazaar and spice bazaar, as well as restaurants and all the â€˜touristyâ€™ shops. Using the tramline to find your way is helpful â€“ just follow it! The entrance to the Ipek Palas is pleasant enough, so too is the bar and the skyline restaurant but the one night we chose to eat there it was empty so there was no atmosphere and we left. But I am sure at the height of the tourist season, it is a great place to eat and from which to gaze over the Istanbul city tops. Staff at the hotel are helpful, especially one of the waiters who went out of his way to find a table on which to put our complimentary tea and cake (which is served every afternoon at 5pm) and who was generally attentive. What marred the stay somewhat was our room. We had holidayed on a budget and our room was very much an economy room with a double bed and a single bed. But the double was against a wall which is inconvenient for getting in and out (especially during the night when you donâ€™t want to crawl all over your partner!) and there were no bedside tables or lamps. These might sound small inconveniences but a little bit of thought could make these lower-priced rooms so much more pleasant â€“ and they do let down an otherwise excellent hotel (during our stay there was constant discreet painting and preparation for the main season). The shower room was a good size but lacked space to place toiletries and the wardrobe was a small single one. I feel sure that had we asked to be moved to a better room, our request would have been granted, but we rather lazily decided to make the most of it as we were only staying for five nights. The person we would have directed any requests or complaints to is kindly Guest Relations lady Bilge Ozdemir who greeted us upon arrival and gave us a summary of what there was to see and do while we sipped complimentary fruit juice. (Talking of fruit juice, I couldnâ€™t fault the breakfast which was a mix of Turkish hot and cold food as well as more European cereals and boiled eggs!) Good experiences in Istanbul: Eating lunch at the tower restaurant across the bridge, the two bazaars and the blue mosque â€“ as well as a Hamman (but that is not for the bashful â€“ wear a swimsuit if you have one!) Bad experiences in Istanbul: The palace, billed as Istanbulâ€™s number one tourist attraction was a disappointment. It is simply a museum and a rather â€˜dryâ€™ one at that with no atmosphere from the days it was inhabited. The â€˜haremâ€™ part sounded interesting but that means paying another entrance fee â€“ and again only comprises empty rooms. The carpet sellers â€“ do not make eye contact with him, engage in any conversation at all or even smile as you will never shake them off â€“ likewise the persistent restaurant staff whose job it is to stand outside their premises and encourage you to eat there. They are not as bad as the carpet salesmen but you do get a bit fed up when you have run the gauntlet of a string of restaurants. Finally, beware the pricing outside restaurants. Sometimes it is in Euros and sometimes in Turkish lire â€“ make sure you are not thinking lire when you see Euros â€“ it makes a lot of difference and we allowed ourselves to be fooled a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tintti71
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and service. Good location. Very nice breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny budget rooms certainly not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: princessBridgend
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a six night stay at the Ipek palace hotel. Yes we gambled on a secret hotel deal with one of the major late booking companies but assumed that as the hotel had a 4 star rating our room would be of a certain standard. Unfortunately for us our room was tiny with a bed pushed against a wall with hardly any room for us to move around or unpack our luggage. The view from our room was of a derelict building strewn with mattresses and rubble. Substantial building work was under way around the hotel resulting in dirty muddy pavements and roads at the entrance to the hote. This is something I think we should have been made aware of by the travel company handling our booking The hotel reception were very understanding explained that the hotel was full for the next 2 nights but agreed to change our room to a different room for the remainder of our stay. Our second room was not much bigger than the first with a tiny wardrobe certainly not capable of containing 2 peoples clothes. It was overlooking a street where a JCB was working on road improvements which meant it was extremely noisy. This hotel has very poor noise proofing between rooms and we found it exetrmeley noisy offering little opportunity for rest and relaxation. Since my return I have seen similar comments about the size of the rooms and the hotels response about them being budget or special offer rooms and that people should pay for an upgrade if they want a better room. However I feel that a 4 star hotel should have a minimum standard of room and I feel that these rooms fall short of this. On the plus side the position of this hotel is excellent, the rooms were cleaned on a daily basis to a very high standard and the roof top terrace restaurant had amazing views over the city. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. I have travelled in Turkey on various occasions and am aware of the differences in standards in relation to its star ratings however this hotel is far from a 4 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay, friendly helpful staff, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: RYM72
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Ipek Palas after a terrible start...we had booked to stay at Diva's Boutique Hotel...We moved to Ipek Palas instead and were so glad we did! The decor is a bit dated, there is construction going on around and if you leave windows open it is quite noisy...However all these issues are insignificant when you consider everything else...As soon as we entered we were made to feel very welcome, we were in the warm and greeted with smiles. There were 6 of us, two children and a 9 month old baby... our rooms were spacious and clean. The breakfast was great with a selection of hot and cold food. The staff were lovely too. The resteraunt upstairs had amazing views of Istanbul and the food was tasty. Location of this hotel is excellent...were were a 5 minute walk away from the Gulhane tram stop and two stops from the Blue Mosque. Topkapi Palace was also just 5 minutes away. We did not expect the hotel to be as good as this. Very helpful friendly staff. Very child friendly... All the staff made our stay a very ennjoyable and memorable one. I would have given full marks had it not been for the construction. Thank you to all the wonderful staff...keep it up! And we will definitely be coming to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff and Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: steviejlarder
Reviews.Content: Thank you for making the stay comfortable and enjoyable. Umit, Aladdin and the the breakfast staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: snoopy082
