Reviews.Content: This hotel provided excellent value - prompt and friendly service, phenomenal breakfast spread (included) which had both warm and cold selections which were very fresh and delicious, very comfortable bed, clean bathroom with an excellent shower (hot and lots of pressure), location that is walking distance from all major site, and best of all, our room had those excellent triple glaze windows that you can open, and a radiator. This meant that the room was silent when the window was closed, we could open the window for fresh air, but we could also control the heat (which is silent!) through the radiator. Spent 8 nights there and would highly recommend it. They have also hired a client relations person who can help you plan and book your tours

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Placed”
Reviews.Author: hillcrestuk
Reviews.Content: It sometimes takes a while to become accustomed to a new place. Once youâ€™ve been in Istanbul for a day or so you will appreciate how well placed the Ipek Palas is. Behind the hotel is a tram station, follow the line and after a ten minute walk you will reach some of the cityâ€™s most important monuments such as the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosques. Fifteen minutes in the opposite direction takes you to the Grand Bazaar and the smaller Spice Bazaar. There have been contrasting reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor, my overall impression was that that the Ipek Palace was a nice place to stay and provided excellent value for money. The staff were warm and welcoming and the hotel was spotless and well managed. Several reviewers have commented that a four star rating is a little generous and I would agree that overall it is more typical of a European three star hotel. Other reviewers have claimed noisy building works in the vicinity interrupted their sleep. While there were building works nearby, I did not find noise to be a problem although they were an obvious eyesore. My main, or should I say my only criticism of the hotel, would be the standard of the â€˜economyâ€™ rooms which tended to be tiny. Certainly more two star than four star, although there are rooms of a better standard available. All the mod cons are there such as air conditioning and a decent en suite but the room itself was small and quite basic. The hotel has a bar and restaurant, neither of which were very busy. Step outside the hotel and there is a vast choice of bars, shops and eateries in the area who will tout for your custom in a persistent and sometimes irritating manner. I found the standard of food to be generally quite mediocre with virtually every restaurant offering the same choices. Breakfast at the hotel was typically Turkish with a good choice of hot and cold food from a large buffet area; donâ€™t expect to find bacon and eggs! Complimentary tea and cakes are served at five in the afternoon in the main reception area. Free wi-fi is available on the ground floor as is internet access via a PC. If youâ€™re looking for value accommodation in Istanbul this hotel is a good choice, just donâ€™t expect four star standards when paying cheap b and b prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great teamwork”
Reviews.Author: Nkoolah
Reviews.Content: Personally,Ramazan went the extra mile for my team.He made us feel very comfortable. Like any other hotel elsewhere,your negotiation skills at the check-in counter will get you a better deal than any prior booking. At the reception Alladin and Kayhan provided all the help I needed. Umit,Aydin,mesut and Bilge did well to make it a worthwhile visit. Hajj Ssali

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, very friendly and helpful staff, hotel is clean but rather dated decor”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul23
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night package with Lastminute.com - great value . Hotel is right by the tramway which goes past most of the main places of interest and is a good landmark for finding your way around the city centre. Main places are walkable within 20 minutes or so.Get the hotel to organise taxis so you don't get ripped off! Very helpful and nice staff who will help you plan your visit if you wish. Great buffet breakfast ! We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant in the evening as there are so many places to choose from in the area. standard double was rather basic , no drawers or much hanging space but good mattresses, clean and fairly quiet. View of derelict buildings from ours! Some others looked a lot more plush. We just about managed to visit all the main places we wanted to including The Blue Mosque, Sulimeyene Mosque, Aghia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, The Cisterns, the Whirling Dervishes display (strange and fascinating) and the Turkish Baths. Take a guide and haggle on the price, ours were very knowledgeable and brought it to life. beautiful at night with the water and lights. Wonderful city, people are great fun I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “riendly staff that was the beginning of rest”
Reviews.Author: Yagmuryapanadam
Reviews.Content: Last summer I went to Istanbul for a business trip. boring and nights on a business trip lasting up to. There was one nice thing about this trip. Ipek Palas. A central location, so time has not passed the road. Cleanliness is certain, do not need mentioning. friendly staff that was the beginning of rest. And the spacious rooms, nice beds. I get there I suggest you to go to your lover. Well I'm in another place in Istanbul, Can I stay? Absolutely not. Only IPEK PALAS

Reviews.Title: “"smells like historical istanbul"”
Reviews.Author: istanbluemosque
Reviews.Content: Ä°pek Palace Hotel was a very good accommodation, the staff at ipek palace hotel were very helpful and funny,service was the best.The hotel is in a perfect location for all the sights 15 minute max walk to all the popular sights.

Reviews.Title: “Back in 2008”
Reviews.Author: Stale_Linda
Reviews.Content: We were travelling back in 2008 during the Ramadan time- not so easy to fall a sleep because of sound. Location is good for shopping and exploring the city. Receptionists were polite and confirmed complimentary late check out. Room was very small but nice decorated, bathroom- not very cleaned. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, kind assistance and good company.”
Reviews.Author: Currypolice
Reviews.Content: A special thanks to Ulas and Ramzan for making us feel well looked after and spoilt. Very good advice and good company throughout stay. WIll be recommending you guys to all our friends and acquaintances. Keep up the good work. Abdul Rakib

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: Tallyho88
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel in March 2011. The hotel is in a perfect location for all the sights 15 minute max walk to all the popular sights. We certainly could not fault the staff they were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was large bright and very clean and the breakfast was plentiful. We booked a cheap short break so we weren't expecting to stay in one of those lovely rooms that you see on the hotels website our twin room was exceptionally small and a little dowdy and smelt of stale cigarette smoke although the beds we comfortable and clean and the en-suite adequate with a good powerful hot shower. Strangely there were no tea and coffee making facility in the room but every day at 5pm free tea, coffee and cakes were served in the foyer. All in all we felt that we had good value and would certainly stay there again albeit in one of better rooms!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel being just a stone throw away from all the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: rafsgyal
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous experience at the Ipek Palas hotel in Istanbul the staff in particular the reception staff Ulas was extremely helpful always smiling and always ready to assist on any question we had. Ulas spoke english very well which was incredibly helpful for us as our first language is english. The hotel is in a wounderful location very close to all major attractions within walking distance. Definately advisable to visit. Great City. Great People. Great Food. Amazing Culture.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roxi786
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Ipek Palas in Istanbul for a city break 25th Feb - 28th Feb 2011. After reading reviews i was sure that this was a very good choice, i was most defeinately pleased and enjoyed my stay there. TYhe hotel staff are kind and at your assistance 24 hours a day. The Hotel itself is clean, modern and within easy reach to all the local amenities and sights which i went to see. reception staff are helpful with information about the local shops and tram/rail services. The waiters and waitresses provided a second to none service. Overall i would be going back to Istanbul in the summer and will surely be staying at Hotel Ipek Palas..Thank You to all the staff for making my city break that little more special.:)))))

Reviews.Title: “Appearances are deceptive”
Reviews.Author: themis789
Reviews.Content: We booked to a family holdiay of 3 ppl for 3 nights. The decor of the hotel is beautiful and apparently it has undergone a total refurb. However the finishing needs to be completed. We had one single wardrobe (enough to hold our coats) to share and when we raised this with the staff they were dissmisive and unhelpful, we lived out of our suitcases throughout our stay! The rooms were very small and cramped, the bathroom door lock didnt work and the door kept shutting with the wind (we couldnt even close the bathroom window), leaving us unable to use the bathroom. The view out of the room was terrible, we had a view of a brick wall on one side and a view of rubble from construction on the otherside, the heating was tempremental, and there was a lot of noise from garbage trucks, screaming tourists...... I agree with soem of the comments by other travellers who had similar problems, arrogant staff, sheet not changed, no pillows.... The reception staff are all out to make money from tourists, i read guide books before i came so had an idea about transport. when i asked the reception where to get the ferry from to go to a town he said it didnt go there and i needed a taxi! i showed him the map and the ferry line which went there and he said no, it doesnt and wanted to know how many people were going, whilst reaching for the phone to order a taxi! i told him not to bother. At the en we went to the port and was told where to get the ferry (1.65L each single trip) compared to the 100's L we would have been charged if we booked with the hotel. Please do not book excursion with the hotel, you can get better & cheaper deal outside. The breakfast was ok, but i agree with other comments i would rate this at 3* ive stayed in 5*/4* hotels and the sevice is a lot better than that of ipek. The only thing going is the superficial decoration and location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars - economy rooms are for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: Birdie_2_11
Reviews.Content: If you have only looked at the positive reviews then your expectations of the accommodation will be set far too high. The beds and rooms are small and sleeping was difficult, even in the fourth room we were shown which was just satisfactory. Paying the extra for a better room may be worth it, but the construction and 6th floor noise will be heard in most rooms and Maintenance is poor which may well effect all rooms. The staff would clearly like your stay to be a pleasant one and we do not have any complaint about them.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: teresazargo
Reviews.Content: We were a very large group of 38 people. We had great time at this hotel. GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF,GREAT BREAKFAST...Our other friends will aslo recommend this hotel here. Our next trip is to Cuba. I hope to find a great hotel like this in there.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon dream”
Reviews.Author: maria78_11
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon in this hotel very romantic and charming rooms. The bosphorus restaurant at the terrace was worthed everything. The rooms were designed as honeymooners with roses....very charming

Reviews.Title: “kinda disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Zina00
Reviews.Content: - on the good side: it has a good location close to the tramway and to most of the important sites, clean, nice breakfast area, beautiful terrace for the restaurant, friendly staff espesially the night shift. - on the down side: when we arrived we called the hotel for the shuffle we were promised and we had to wait for about an hour and a hal jstf to find tht they sent us a driver from another hotel waiting for other customers to arrive so we had to wait an extra hour! we had a special offer because we were honeymooners to spend the 1st 3 nights in a honeymoon room which i assumed was one of their theme rooms as it says on the website but we were put in a standard room for the 1st night and on the 2nd nite we were moved to a corner suite which was also kind of a disappointment and we only spent 2 nights in it. they dont stick to their words and we had booked 9 nights for the same rate but at the last 3 nights they doubled it so we moved to a different hotel. no electric plugs in the room for a laptop or charger, and we were promised a room far from the construction but they put us in the closest 1 to it. the hairdryer in the room didnt work. very poor lighting in the rooms, very small closets no place for clothes, and the bathroom had a bad smell. oh and roomservice didnt change the sheets often.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in old city; safe for solo female tourists”
Reviews.Author: trinichuck
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Ipek Palas when I stayed in July of 2009. From the minute I got out of the taxi I was made to feel completely at ease by the hotel staff. They were extremely courteous and friendly. The hotel is not too far from the old city and within 15 minutes walk to St. Sophia, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. A few minutes walk in the other direction will take you to a more vibrant and hip Istanbul where you can watch people go through their daily activities. The morning buffet was a virtual smorgassboard of Mediterranean food, and the restauant provides a grand view of ships coming into port and a hodge podge of rooves and minarets that periodically pop up in the skyline. My room was small, but adequate. I didn't mind because I hardly spent time in there except only to sleep. When I go back to Turkey, I'm staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul east meets west”
Reviews.Author: magicnic
Reviews.Content: metro underground building meant taxi could not get to hotel on arrival and the noise until 2am was terrible. Also visited the tunnelling in Kadikoy(on the asian side) where there were no hotels near the tunnel works. The tunnel will take up to 2 years to complete. Reception should have had some ear plugs. We found some in a chemist in the road with the squeaking tram way about 100yards from the hotel. The Ipek is well placed for visting old istanbul you can walk to grand bazaar, topkapi palace, 2 mosques sofia and blue, spice market, galata bridge and boats. hotel staff were helpful

Reviews.Title: “A problem solved is a problem halved”
Reviews.Author: MockneyRed
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul for five days / four nights with my wife, for a Turkish friend's wedding. The Hotel Ipek Palas is very central, and within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Castle; and to the tram to visit other areas of Istanbul. There are major renovations happening behind the hotel, but this is not too much of an issue. On the same block as the hotel is a Mosque, and various characterful local chai shops where you can while away and hour or so and it feels like a real local neighbourhood place, despite being so central. The rooms in the hotel are of varying size - the hotel is a triangular building, much like the prow of a ship. Consequently, some double rooms are tiny, while others at the same price are more than generous in their size. We asked to change from a smaller room after the first night, given that my wife was pregnant, and this was not an issue. The staff are, generally, extremely friendly and helpful - which we found most people to be during our stay. I wouldn't say they try to 'upsell' you more than anywhere else in the tourist areas to eat in their restaurant. It would be fair to say that more has been invested in 'front of house' than in the upkeep of some of the rooms. We had other relatives and friends staying in the hotel for the wedding, so saw a variety of rooms - and many had loose sockets, wobbly bathroom fittings, and in the case of one room, a sharp edge on a safety catch on the door where this had been snapped by a previous guest. This did actually tear the cloth of my suit jacket - a problem for which, to their eventual credit, the hotel reimbursed me following some correspondence with them. For all this, this is a good value hotel - in terms of the room rates and generous inclusive breakfast which fuels you for a day exploring Istanbul. It has an excellent location if you are visiting the city for the first time, and I would rate it 3.5 out of 5 on balance.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fubar8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my family in October.First time we visited Istanbul.We found this hotel with an advice.A frend of mine stayed here before and he higly recommended me to stay in Ipek Palas hotel. Everything was wonderful in the hotel.Breakfast is perfect in open buffet.lobby is big and comfortable.there are two computers that guests can use free with internet.there is a terrace restaurant and its wiew is wonderful,you can see all bosphorus opposite you.. Staff is very helpful.whenever we go to lobby,the staff who work in lobby wants to order us drinks..we didn't want to go outside really..location of the hotel is excellent.you can walk in 5 or 10 minutes to all historical and touristic places.. Just go and stay in Ipek Palas.You will like more this wonderful city in this wonderful hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Be careful, or you might get ripped off”
Reviews.Author: bezoar25
Reviews.Content: I had booked 4 rooms with this hotel via booking.com at quite short notice. It was actually a second option because I had booked the night before at a different hotel; however, that hotel emailed me to inform me that they were in fact overbooked and did not have the rooms I booked available. Learning from that, after booking online, I called Ipek Palas to confirm that the rooms I had booked were truly booked. I gave them the details of my booking and asked them to check that they had the rooms available. I was informed that, actually, just like the previous hotel, they didn't have 4 rooms available. I asked several times to ensure that I understood correctly. Their front desk repeated that they were fully booked. You can imagine my surprise when I was charged for those 4 rooms. And when I tried to sort it out with them, their arguments flip flopped from agreeing that they had been fully booked to, after 3 phonecalls 'oh, we were only fully booked after we booked your 4 rooms.' Bottomline is - don't give them access to your credit card because they won't hesitate to cheat you.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel In A Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: ZOOMER87
Reviews.Content: Il cut the long story short. We stayed her for 7 nights found the location to be close to the most of the major attractions. The lobby looks great but we found everything else at best average. The receptionist present could do with a refresher course on providing good customer service. She hardly said two words and never once smiled. On the plus side, she did deal with my room change request promptly. although we should have been put in a double room in the first place. A twin room with two beds pushed together is hardly favourable for a newly wed couple. The rooms however were fairly clean. The breakfast was limited and we were greatful to have a Mcdonalds round the corner. I found that it lacked variety, and found it unreasonable to pay for a glass of orange juice. Be aware that ther is plenty of construction around the vicinity of the hotel, and the noise of the construction will be audible auntil 1AM every morning. We dont ask for much when were away at hotels. We just require the basics to be done to a good standard. Istanbul on the other hand is a fantastic city with soo much to do an see. And the hotel really didnt have any effect on the fun we had here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend it even if you're on a budget - look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: JenLouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in late September. The weather was gorgeous and it was out first visit to Istanbul so thankfully we were out and about most of the time and only came back to freshen up or sleep. We booked this as a Top Secret Hotel deal on lastminute, and as we were told the star rating, amenties etc we thought it was a pretty safe bet. We booked a Standard Room with Breakfast for 7 nights. On arrival I was a bit surprised by the amount of building/demolition work going on but thought, hoped, our room would be ok and we wouldnt notice it. When we were shown to our room, via an elevator that Im pretty sure should be a laundry chute rather than an elevator, we couldn't believe how small it was - once we put our suitcase down (luckily we just had the one!) one of us had to get onto the bed so the other could pass!!! I asked the porter if he sure this was a Standard room as opposed to an Economy room, he told us to ask at reception. We did, and we were told that there were infact rooms smaller than ours. I have to admit we had a sneaky peak around when the maids were cleaning and we never found one smaller but we were assured there were and we couldn't switch as the hotel was at full capacity. Then came the building works. Apart from the view from our room (third floor) looking directly at the demolition work we hoped that as we would be up and out early and back in the evening, that it wouldn't impact on our time there. I have to admit that for the first few days it was fine, but then, the last few nights before the end of our stay, we would come back from a lovely day out, in serious need of a sit down/sleep, to find bulldosers working with flashlights and torches in the dark, twice it was after 10pm and close to 11 when they finally stopped. Hardly what you'd expect on a relaxing break and not much point in making use of the rooftop restaurant!! I lay most of the blame with Lastminute, as if I had have booked this hotel the usual way I could have checked the reviews first. I really feel that lastminute should either remove this hotel from the Top Secret Hotel list until the building work around has been completed, or at least put a warning in somewhere before you commit to staying here. On the upside the hotel was very clean and within walking distance to all amenties. I would just say check and double cheack the room you think you're getting as I didnt find one that resembled the hotels website!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chump321
Reviews.Content: I have to warn you to make sure that you check what type of room you are getting. Their regular room is very small. If you upgrade, then you will be more comfortable. We were able to switch rooms half way through our trip. OUr first room was very small and smelled. The hotel has a great restaurant and amazign food, the best food we had in all of Turkey. THe rooms itself are mediocre, its no hilton or hyatt, but if your okay with mediocre then it will do.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel and Exceptional Service!!”
Reviews.Author: elarai
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited Turkey from Athens for the first time in August to see the famous Hagia Sophia and everything else that Istanbul has to offer! We booked this hotel online and were definitely impressed with the service. When we arrived, the guest relations representative greeted us and helped us plan our trip! He was extremely helpful throughout our stay and we even became good friends! The rooms were always clean and the breakfast was phenomenal! I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone! It is right in the heart of the city which makes it easy to walk to the main tourist areas such as Hagia Sofia, Blue mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topaki Palce etc. Had a great time at the hotel!!! Many thanks from your neighbors in Greece!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst sleep experience ever....”
Reviews.Author: Holah
Reviews.Content: We booked this via Lastminute.com - reception commented on this when we arrived and I have a funny feeling this fact resulted in our room allocation options being what they were. The first room we were given was the ground floor right by the bar - it was also tiny + shabby, but the main issue was the obvious ensuing noise... we asked for an alternative and were told there was only one other room "available to you" which we took as at least it was on an upper floor away from the bar. The restaurant was directly over head so we were "disturbed" every morning, however the room comfort did not result in our wishing to lie in. To say our room did not resemble those featured is an understatement. The room was again very shabby, so much so I can't really confirm if it as clean or not (there were maids going into the rooms each morning though so I guess it probably was - just didn't look it). The primary issue however was that it was so small there was no space for a chest of drawers even - the bed was pushed up against the wall on one side (it had to be in order to provide space sufficient to open the door!). Ordaining to turn over resulted in my turning the wall light on. We both had to sleep on our sides anyway as the bed was essentially a large single - we only have a 4ft 6" bed ourselves and no way was it that big. Every morning my back hurt - I would have slept on the floor in order to stretch out and lie on my back for a night, but there was literally not enough space to lie down there. Sometimes seeing really is believing. On a positive note, communal areas are clean, the bar area very chic / trendy (drinks a bit pricey but Istanbul is not as cheap as the rest of Turkey by any stretch), and the breakfast was fine, plus there was the promised roof-top view from the restaurant, although many other restaurants which we ate out in have the same or better. Istanbul is a fantastic city, spotlessly clean, walkable, fascinating and so culturally rich with lovely green spaces - it also felt very safe and the local people very friendly. This hotel is in a good location for seeing all he major sites and there are lots of eating options nearby. All of his however did not compensate for the room - I've stayed in New York, Paris and Hong Kong before, all of which are "notorious" for small room sizes. None even came close to this though - seriously I have seen bigger walk-in wardrobes.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location,friendly staff,reasonable room and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: samarDubai
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay as the hotel is ideally located in the centre of Old Town and within walking distance to major tourist attractions and many good restaurants. Our double room was of good size with two large wndowsand very good room service. Breakfast was just reasonable, no juices though,if you want one only orange juice is available at a cost

Reviews.Title: “its a great hotel but the staff made it better.”
Reviews.Author: ahmedManama
Reviews.Content: ipek palas was a excellent hotel specielly the people that worked thier like bekir he was a nice friend helped us much and the hotel was just perfecet it was very nice made us injoy in tukey,istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely NOT recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexWarszawa
Reviews.Content: We spend last weekend in the hotel and it was not a good experience. Price does not match the quality. We had numerous problems, like TV not working, or broken internet (very important for both of us). We got completely ignored by the front office, they said, that the internet going to be available after the weekendâ€¦ Front office staff â€“ zero points. The hotel has nice terrace but breakfast is served in a basement which is kind of depressing. Plus just across the street there is a construction side, so you need to keep the windows closed. To be fair our room was clean and spacious, but for this price you can do much, much better. Alex

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: SJHorrocks
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Ipek Palace was very enjoyable, friendly staff and a great location for all the main sites. The economy rooms are very compact, so as I was staying for 5 nights, I asked for a bigger room after the first night and this was provided at no extra cost. The main plus of the hotel is the location in the old town, close to the Topkapi, Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque, all within easy walking distance. The hotel is also close to the main ferry terminals, for river trips up the Bosphorous. There is building work going on around the hotel, but I did not personally find this a problem.

Reviews.Title: “IpeK Palas hotel is the best place to stay in Instanbul, it felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: UniversumViator
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our three teenagers at Ipek Palas hotel early July in 2010. There are numerous plus points to talk about this hotel but if I had to choose one it would be its staff. We stayed five nights there. Two of our luggage was lost even before we arrived to Turkey and the staff at the front desk went beyond expectations to help us out and they were very patient and helpful. Borjo, Emren, and Fatih were there at the front desk in three different shifts and they were all kind and helpful. TWO THUMBS UP!. Another thing about this hotel was the location, it was in the walking distance of many historical sites which made it easy to go to one, come back and refresh and go to another. The rooms and other amenities were perfect. The breakfast was great. The other staff were friendly and helpful as well. It truly was a delight to stay there. I will go back to Istanbul and Turkey again. I loved the country and the people and when I go back to Istanbul I will go Ipek Palas. After Istanbul we went to Antalya and there we stayed in 5 star, extremely luxurious hotel. All of us, even the teenagers compared this second hotel with Ipak Palas and we all agreed that we prefer Ipek Palas over this other fiver star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely loacted hotel with frendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Suomi-boy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and its staff, very helpfull. Breakfast was included. Everybody spoke English well. There was some construction noice but only outside. Aircondition helped also at this hot period. Nice location close to the historic areas, but still good connections to some e.g. nightlife places downtown. Trams and taxes worked very well and were reliable and easy to use. Hammam was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chrissywilks
Reviews.Content: We secured an excellent price for this hotel, and from arrival to departure, found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. On arrival, the air conditioning in our room wasn't fully working, and within ten minutes it had been repaired. Contrary to other reviews, we felt that the room size was fine, and the shower was excellent. We would recommend the hotel, and we will be using it again the next time we go to Istanbul. Nice breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: sanah30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay and i would definately recommend it to everyone. The staff are friendly and respond to any requests straight away. When you arrive a member of staff greets you and refreshing drinks are given which was great when you have had a long journey! Information connected with the hotel is given and any questions we had were answered. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The breakfast is fantastic especially as its available till half ten! The location of the hotel is perfect as it is ten minutes away from the blue mosque and saint sophia as well as restaurants being right outside so you don't have to travel far for sheesha or food. In particular, a member of staff called Bekir was very helpful and friendly. He dealt with any problems and requests we had straight away as well as making us feel welcome. A great member of staff who i hope to see next year when i stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, poor room sizes...”
Reviews.Author: Xshaan
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk into the hotel the lobby hits you as being quite grand with marble flooring and welcome air conditioning. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. As we made our way to our room we we bundled into a wooden box which we assumed was an elevator. it had no grating or safety door on the front so you could touch the floors going passed as the lift rose. We arrived at our room which when opened to us caught us by surprise. The hotel website or the travel service we booked with did not mention that the room would not have sufficient space to swing a cat, and although the room was booked as an economy double I expected more from a 4 star hotel. The bathroom was impossible to manoeuvre in and two people in this room would be constantly bumping into each other. The view from the window was a hotel undergoing construction across the road. Needless to say we could not stay in such a small room and spoke to reception which were able to upgrade our room to a standard double for an extra charge of Â£15 extra per night. Although we were unhappy to pay the extra money as we felt we had not been given the proper information regarding the size of the room, we could not reside in such a small living area. The new room was much bigger along with a more spaced out bathroom. However the view remained the same and the free wifi didn't quite reach our room. Location wise the hotel is situated in the best possible location for access to the main attractions of Istanbul by foot. The Agia Sofia Museum and Blue mosque is approx 10-15 mins walk with the Basilica Cistern and Topkapi palace being just before them on the same road. The guest relations representative in the hotel was very entertaining and pleasant to talk with and he would always check whether we required anything or recommend places to visit. Majority of hotel staff were nice and tried to make your stay an enjoyable experience. There is no shortage of restaurants very near to the hotel and would definitely recommend you find Sirin Kofte & Doner House located just up a few steps to the right of the train station, or from the hotel, bear left out of the doors, then left at the crossroads, then right by a green corner restaurant, to the end of the row. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the wide range of food is quite exquisite and is definitely cheaper then the local competitors. They are not afraid to go the extra mile to make sure you return again and again. All in all the hotel was sufficient for our stay once we upgraded. But double check if you are booking an Economy double. I would recommend this hotel as the staff make your stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINATELY RECOMMMEND”
Reviews.Author: arif123
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Ipek Hotel. Staff were very friendly and welcoming, The rooms are a good size. The only problem was the construction works that were outside our hotel window, though this had nothing to do with the hotel itself it did cause some disturbance in the night time as work would continue unitl the early hours of the morning. Would definately stay at the hotel again nice clean and air con is brilliant!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robdog1966
Reviews.Content: Definitely expected more from a 4* hotel. We stayed in a 'concept room' and found it tired and dated. The fittings were dusty and in some parts falling off the walls. The hotel has pretty much nothing in terms of additional facilities. However, the rooms are clean and the air con works (loudly). The hotel is also right next to a major construction site so expect lots of drilling and banging between 7pm and 1am. On the plus side, the hotel has a great location and is in walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and all the other major sights. The breakfast buffet whilst based on quantity and not quality is nevertheless good if you need to fill up. However, the fresh squeezed orange juice at 5TL is frankly a rip off and can be bought for 1TL outside.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION & CUSTOMER SERVICE PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Bourne5
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in Sultanahmet I was not sure the area would be as nice. Huge shock as the location was fantastic! - The Hotel is within walking distance to all major sites & just 2 minutes to the Bosphorus! - I walked to the Grand Bazaar, the Mosques, the Museums & around the corner a fabulous Turkish Bath! - The hotel itself offers a wonderful breakfast & the staff are extremely helpful. I did have a problem with my room as there was construction going on behind the hotel & I was moved immediately to a better room. The area is not as 'pretty' as Sultanahmet but the Hotel & location impressed me so much that I look forward to returning there. P.S. I am female travelling alone and I felt very safe in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Emilie189541
Reviews.Content: I can surely recommend others to stay at Hotel Ipek Palace, because of it's good location in the old part of town in walking distance of the Blue Mosk, Hagia Sophia and the Sultan's Palace. The rooms are very clean, the decor is charming and there is aircondition. The breakfirst buffet is something you look forward to every morning, likewise the beautiful view of the sunset from the roof top terasse. I can also recommend you to eat at the Hotel's restaurant and enjoy the good food, while you see a very skillfull and elegant women preform belly dancing. Have a wonderful stay at Hotel Ipek Palace. Emilie, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Abdulrahmandubai
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel with a lot of friendly service and an amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, excellent service, ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Rookie_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. Excellent hospitality by all staff and particularly Bekir the Guest Relations Manger - Bekir was very knowledgeable about the city and its history, very polite and friendly and nothing was too much trouble for him. The location of the hotel was ideal in relation to the historical sights, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market and the Bosphoros which are all within walking distance. We will certainly stay there again. Naseem & Farook

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, clean and affordable place in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: spacestoepsel
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the choice of Ipek Pals for your 4-night stay in Istanbul, and would definively recommend it further. The staff is really very friendly and always fulfilled our wishes. Even changing the room type on short notice was not a problem. Even though the hotel has to face a huge construction site right next to it where work goes on also late at night, the room we were given (614) was quiet and didn't empede our sleeping in any way. It was spacious and nicely designed, und would get cleaned and arranged every day. The breakfast takes place in the basement (and not at the rooftop restaurant, like some pictures suggest), but the buffet is very rich and changes day to day. The nice view from the rooftop terrace and restaurant is surely also a bonus of this place, especially at sunset times. Sometimes there are free belly-dancing shows in the evening at the rooftop restaurant. Wireless internet in the rooms is free, and there is also a free internet PC in the lobby. The hotel is perfectly located, with all major sights in walking distance, and also a few hundred meters away from the central tram line. I would come again to this place on a next visit to this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels i ever booked”
Reviews.Author: VladToto
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a local agency in my town,because i wanted to stay somewhere in the central areas of Istanbul . The hotel looked nice in the pictures,but when I arrived there I actually found out it looked even better. Sure,the room I had booked was low-cost, single-bed (I was traveling alone) but it had TV,AC,mini-bar (of course,one of my rules is to not touch the mini-bar,but i did open it to see what was inside and i was amazed at it's content).There was no problem regarding te cleanliness of the hotel. Everyday,they would change my bedsheets,towels and just clean my room up. Also,the hotel staff was more than friendly.I had been also given a lot of great advices from one of the locals,Bekir (a great guy) who works there as a PR. I was advised on the best places to visit and also which areas i should dodge for safety reasons. All in all ,I had a great time there (the lobby,which really looks like a big,victorian living-room,is an excellent place to meet new people or just drink some tea and watch the BBC news),a great time especially while having dinner in the hotels' restaurant (which offers a great(!!!) view of the Bosphorus Bridge and surrounding area). They have good,cheap food aswell. Plus the hotel is situated within walking range of all major tourist attractions. I have to say, I have made a lot of new friends there and I certainly miss Istanbul-a great city .

Reviews.Title: “Need to get the basics right”
Reviews.Author: woza1318
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Ipek Palas hotel with some trepidation after reading some of the mixed reports on trip advisor.Theese fears were initially unfounded as we discovered that we had been upgraded to a family room on the third floor which although rather small was tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean.After a long journey it would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room At first the air conditioning in the room did not work but this was fixed by the porter who replaced the batteries in the remote control.Carrying out further checks we found that although there was a mini bar in the room there were no drinking glasses anywhere[the management does not supply them any more],There was nowhere to hang a toilet bag in the bathroom and the shower fitting was loose.The internal door leading to the tiny balcony did not fit the wooden frame and would not shut. Unfortunately for us our room was overlooking the excavation sight next to the hotel.The noise of lorries being loaded with rubble well into the night was dreadful causing us to loose many hours sleep.Sadly for future Ipek Palas guests this looks likely to continue for the foreseeable future. The hotel is ideally placed for all the tourist attractions,the basement breakfast room was beautifully tiled and decorated and the choice and quality of the breakfast was excellent.We also had a lovely dinner in the terrace restaurant where the food and value for money was outstanding. On conclusion it would appear that the owners have made the classic mistake of not getting the basics right before indulging ina few luxuries after all this is the first hotel that we have stayed in that did not have a toaster in the breakfast room!!

Reviews.Title: “An avegae hotel, we expected a little more.”
Reviews.Author: lovs2travel1985
Reviews.Content: Before going to Istanbul, I made sure to do as much research as possible for hotels with great locations etc. Although Trip Advisor gives quite a mixed response to the Ipek Palas, I still went ahead and booked it. We were four friends, who wanted to stay in the same room. Inititally I booked a standard double as it was just me and a friend. After the booking, this increased to four all together, so I contacted the hotel and asked for an upgrade that had a balcony. I was told that only the family rooms had a balcony and that we would have to pay an additional 180 euros for the 6 night stay, which was fine. As we arrived at the hotel, I was disappointed with thesurrounding area, its quite claustrophobic and the construction site is about 5 meters away from the entrance. The hotel lobby was quite nice, and as we walked in, the bel boy insisted that he take our luggage. He grabbed for two and broke the strap on both straight away! thanks! I then went to check in, and they looked a little confused to see four people instead of two. I had of course printed off my emails with the hotel. I was informed that a family suite was not possible as it was based on 2 adults and 2 children. I didn't really care what it was based on as I had my confirmation, and we wanted a balcony! The senior member of staff (dont remember his name) looked quite irritated at the staff who had confirmed this, and asked if we would prefer to have the largest suite in the hotel that caters for 8 people, he said it was the best and that it was in our best interest. after a while, we agreed as it seemed there was no choice, but that room had no balcony. (This worked out better actually, as the balcony is tiny, so you cannot actually sit out on it, or stand as there is a flower box that takes up all the space, no pont at all!) we were taken up, and it was a nice room, spacious. Four girls, a lot of space, but one toilet/shower room, which we thought for such a big room was rather daft. The hotel itself is located in a great place, walking distance to everything. The service is good at first, but gets so annoying after your first day. One of my friends is Turkish so could speak the laguage (thank god!) It seemed that one of the staff (a manager I think) took a liking to her and would just not get the message and get lost! He is soooo unbelievably irritating. I don't know his name, but if you go there, trust me you will know him straight away, he just hangs around way too much. the breakfast is not on the roof terrace as stated, its in the basement, but still nice. It's an ok breakfast, but most of the time, they ran out of the bread and hot dishes. but have a great fruit selection. On out last day, they kept turning the lights on and off whilst people were still eating (breakfast ends at 10:30, it was about 10:35), we thought this was very rude, just let your guests finish up in peace! You get hassled everyday to attend their dinners and entertainment night, but we had learnt a trick to avoid this...run! The room service was good when they did clean the room. If you plan on leaving the room late, then make sure to tell the reception staff you want your room cleaned, else it wont get done, this was very disappointing, as we expected that if we are leaving at 13:00, housekeeping would still be around? So if you are planning a late night, do inform the staff you want your room cleaned the next day! There are many restaurants surrounding the hotel, and they all want you to eat there. it's funny at first how they all try to get you to say yes. If I'm honest, the best food we had was the vendors by the Bosphorous, fresh fish in a bun, was delicious!!! and about 10 times cheaper than the restaurants! you need to try the seafood! The hotel also has wi-fi and a computor for guest use (just one, which is always in use...and only of the net is actually working!) We also met a fellow guest on his last night who was moaning about that male staff member who had said quite a number of inappropriate things to him as he was travelling with two girls, one being "are they your harem girls". He was annoyed and offended at this statement and what was the need to state this? once the staff member had realised that we couldn't stand him (he has short black hair, about 5' 7" and the most irrititating voice), he started to back off a little, though this took the length of our stay! The beds were very comfy, which was the reason why we couldn't get out of bed early after a late night! Istanbul at night looks so beautiful, so it's hard to go back to the hotel. You always get offered free drinks and food and desserts, try it! the apple tea was my fav! If you go to the grand bazar, dont bother buying anything, its so expensive, and you'll find that the local areas sell the same items for much cheaper! sometimes half the price. Overall, Istanbul was fab, I will defo go back. I wouldn't however stay at Ipek Palas...although our room was fine, it was pure luck that we got that room, and second time round I would not pay for it, as it would be a lot more than what we paid! It certainly is not four/five star, I would say it's more a good 3 star stay. If you do stay there though, only go if you get a good discounted price, else, dont bother! The pictures on the website look really great, but in reality, it's a much duller, less colourful room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service from staff”
Reviews.Author: rayan92
Reviews.Content: Staff was not only helpfull, but going extra mile to help. I booked through Lastminute, the room was situated where there was a building work in progress hence very noisy day and night. After first night i requested for a change,Staff was very helpfull to change the room quickly. Staff was very helpfull to book my taxi, book my tour or guidance for a place with always smile on their face. My sleep was distracted by the car horns outside,but that is not hotel's fault. It would be very helpfull if some staff at the restaurant would be speaking some english aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little boutique Hotel, at reasonable prices and with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: martinsw2
Reviews.Content: Having booked another Hotel called Petrol Palace and arriving to a completely shocking dump of a place, we were really relieved to manage to get a room straight away in this lovely Hotel, and at a very reasonable rate for a triple room. The Ipek Palas sent their Hotel car to "rescue" us from the Petrol Palas which quite frankly some-one should light a match to! The Ipek has been very tastefully renovated to reflect it Ottoman heritage. Interestingly this building has been an Hotel since it 1st opened its doors in 1889, and they current owners have made great efforts to capture this wonderful heritage. Therefore if you are visiting Istanbul to get a taste of Turkish and Ottoman History, this Hotel is definitely recommended for you! There is free wifi which works well enough, the breakfast is wonderful and we also tried the top floor restaurant which has spectacular views over the Bosphorus and Golden Horn. Free entertainment from a belly dancer and wonderful food with a 20% discount, make this restaurant comparable in price to other street eateries in the area. The only down side is that as this is such an old Hotel, the rooms are quite small - there is not much space to hang clothes up etc. However, the location is excellent - near to all the best sites, so you probably won't want to spend lots of time in the room!! Also there is construction work going on still, on the Underground vent right next to the Hotel. Our room was on the opposite side, and we found it was of minimal annoyance - but having read some of the other reviews, it is probably worth making sure you are not on the wrong side of this Hotel! To sum up: wonderful friendly staff; historical charm, clean, good location, and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, accomodation, staff and location fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: seyhan0
Reviews.Content: Staff: Staff were very friendly, smiley, professional and everybody spoke excellent English. Hotel: The interior of the hotel is very charming, it has a very romantic bar area. The lobby is great where you can also watch TV. There is a PC available for free internet access and generally free wireless access, the WEP key is available through reception. The location was fantastic, all major tourist attractions were within walking distance: Topkapi palace, grand bazaar, spike bazar, blue mosque, hagia sophia, taksim. You have a tram station just around the corner from the hotel which made it easy to go a little further if you wanted to. Every area of the hotel was extremely clean. Restaurant: They have a rooftop terrace with faboulus views of the bosphorus. You got a 20% discound if you are a hotel resident which makes a big difference :-) The food is very good, staff are very friendly and the service is extremely good. The restaurant manager ertugrul was very nice, friendly and gave us some very good advice on which areas of Istanbul to visit. He was teaching my boyfriend a little turkish each day, which was much appreciated :-) Thanks to Ertugrul for making our trip so special :-) They also had special entertainment on some nights e.g. a gorgeous bellydancer and some more traditional folklore dancing, which was absolutely fantastic. Room: The room was cleaned to a very high standard and the room was very nice and comfortable. I would definitely go there again and recommend it to everybody, you will have a fantstic time! Seyhan & Kev

Reviews.Title: “Location great. Noise from construction site. And watch out for the TV repair man!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishTeacherGlenn
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ipek Palas through Lastminute.com. The price was low but as I booked it with a flight I dont know exactly what I paid, I guess it was Â£30 per night for an economy single. The room was quite small but not the smallest single I have stayed in. It was world cup time so I was really annoyed that the TV did not recieve the Turkish channel that was showing it (TRT). When I asked someone to look at the TV they sent someone to my room. When I arrived in the room the man they had sent was going through my emails on my computer!!!!!!!! I was totally shocked. Regarding the noise I have read another review that the noise is over. This is an incredibly optimistic interpretation. The noise levels were very high, both from the 24hr construction site that was 20 meters from my room and from the constant tooting of horns by impatient motorists outside the hotel. On the positive side, the breakfast was very nice and the staff were really trying hard. If you are female you should understand the usual warnings about Turkish men that you can read in other reviews. I had a great time in Istanbul but not because of the hotel.. on the other hand it was cheap (definitely no way four star- more a 3 star struggling under the difficult circumstances of the construction next door). I would not have a problem staying there again but only if it was cheap, otherwise I would go elsewhere. To finish on a positive note the location is excellent in terms of transport links and a good atmosphere in the streets around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and friendly--construction noise over!”
Reviews.Author: engprof
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in June and found the hotel quiet at night--no problem. The breakfast buffet is wonderful, the staff friendly and patient. There was even a party for the opening of the rooftop restaurant--gorgeous view. Don't worry about the noise--good hotel and very convenient to everything!

Reviews.Title: “certainly a place to return to”
Reviews.Author: Alma99_10
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. In 2008 we visited Istanbul and we stayed here. We liked it so much, and that's why we are back here. Certainly, when will visit Istanbul, next time, we will make the booking at this hotel. Very nice stuff; clean room (not very large, but, after all, nobody visit Istanbul to stay all day in the hotel room), the food is good. The wireless internet is free and works good enough. Also, it has very good location, nearest Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and lot of touristic sites.It has all it needs to be a recomanded place: great location, clean rooms, very good services

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keroauc
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week here between May 11th to May 17th on our honeymoon. The location is superb for walking to the Grand Bazaar, the Egyptian Markets ( Spice Bazaar ) and the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia. The breakast was great it filled you up till late afternoon. The service was also great. We read the morning we were flying to Istanbul regards the construction work and were concerned about it and emailed them . We had a prompt reply promising us to be put to the quieter side of the hotel . Our airconditioner worked fine and had a large room (would have sleeped 3 people, double/ single ) even though we booked a double . Also there is free internet access with an available PC near the bar area . There was construction work at one side of the hotel going on through the night and I would recommend this hotel to friends if they were guaranteed a room on the opposite side of the hotel away from the noise or when the construction work is completed . Also breakfast was in the basement when we were staying there looks as though this has been done up now for this service would have preferred to have it in the it in the roof terrace which is the restaurant area providing evening meals The surrounding area is great for food there are restaurants open till about midnight even later and also a couple of small shops to buy water and snacks . There is a great feel about this area and quite safe to walk around. Just walking outside the hotel you feel you are in the old quarter. It definetly had Location Location Location .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gaga976
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband during the F1 race weekend. He went to the race and I've explored the town. The hotel is located in the perfect part of the old town surrounded with numerous restaurants, cafes and shops (also places where you can buy water, snacks...). It is just 5-6min. walk from the Sultanahmet Square and the blue tram line is 1-2min. walk. The sea is 5min. The lobby is really 4*, but some rooms are not. Our room was pretty small. But it didn't matter to us, because it was clean and we used it just for shower and sleep. The stuff is very helpful and friendly and the breakfast is great. There are 86 different things to choose from. Just be careful to ask for the room that doesn't face the construction site in front of the hotel. It is very important or you want get sleep at all. We knew about that, so we asked for the room oriented to the other side of the street. The reception personnel had no problem with that and they gave us the quiet one. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check if the building work is finished!!!! Give it a few months.”
Reviews.Author: Kids-as-well
Reviews.Content: At the moment there are huge building works directly beside the hotel and this work is going on through the night. If you are on that side of the hotel then it is a nightmare. We were moved to the quieter side and things improved, but were still not great. Such a shame, because the hotel is in a great location and the staff were brilliant. We ended up stuck in Istanbul for an extra week due to the volcano and the staff were so helpful in contacting the airport and the BA offices for us. We did move hotel for this extra 6 nights as we needed a change of venue and some peace and quiet. I would stay here again, but only when the building was finished.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely terrible, not worth the money - big construction site behind the hotel”
Reviews.Author: brawan
Reviews.Content: can not recommend this hotel, stay was aweful. - noisy - bad service - no remote to aircondition - airconditition did not work - claustrophobiclly small rooms

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend trip in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ilhan78
Reviews.Content: we went to istanbul just for a couple of days. it was the first time for my girlfriend so we had to do the hole tourist thing. we choose this hotel cause it is realy in the center of all old intressting buildings. the hotel is really nice designed and the hotel staff made us enjoy our time in the hotel. not to forget the great view from the rooftop restaurant. the next time we visit istanbul we will stay at the same place they speak perfect english, german and ......

Reviews.Title: “A helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RC-Music
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Ipek Palas. It is a hotel full of charm, with a roof-top restaurant affording wonderful views across the Golden Horn. Some of the rooms can be rather noisy - especially with construction-work going on at the moment, but the hotel is always willing to change the room if asked

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ldn1
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here in early April for a week and had a wonderful time. We asked for a room away from the construction works â€“ it was clean, small but comfortable and tastefully decorated, with a desk, a coffee table and a sofa. Most importantly, everything worked with no problems â€“ warm shower, air con, TV, Wi-Fi etc... plus the hairdryer and the safe, neither of which we used, really, but they worked! There was a mini-bar as well. The windows were double-glazed. All in all, a comfortable place to be when not out seeing the sights. Thereâ€™s a bar/lounge area downstairs, which serves drinks and snacks, and a computer which is handy for the internet, but they also have free Wi-Fi in the rooms. The breakfast room at the top has a panoramic view of Istanbul â€“ a great start to the day. There's a mixed buffet where youâ€™re bound to find something to your taste. Each morning the staff served something slightly different. All the staff there were friendly and helpful, quick to provide information on where to go and particularly Burcu, who seemed to have leaflets for everything! Would have taken a boat trip along the Bosphorus, but on the days we thought we might, it was pouring with rain, the only downside to our stay. Leaving the hotel, itâ€™s an easy walk to some of the major sights â€“ itâ€™s close to Gulhane Park, and fairly easy to get to Aga Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern etc. My partner had an injury and couldnâ€™t walk very far, so we found it convenient to be situated close to two tram stops, great for exploring the city, which is otherwise not that great for accessibility. Going in the other direction â€“ away from Sultanahmet â€“ itâ€™s easy to get to the Spice Bazaar and then across the bridge nearby to the more modern side of Istanbul, complete with its own attractions. Location-wise, Ipek Palas gets a 10/10. Itâ€™s close enough to bars and restaurants without being on top of them; itâ€™s also a nice distance from the major attractions â€“ a short walk, without being in the middle of the tourist crowd. The rooms were nothing to complain about, unless you plan on taking the kitchen sink with you! But what made it really were the staff. Warm, welcoming, and helpful. Worth contacting the hotel about airport transfers - we only did on the way back, and the car was reasonable, and prompt. The only thing the staff couldnâ€™t do was improve the weather outside, but we wonâ€™t hold that against them. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JanenNick
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to the Ipek Palas when the Icelandic volcano erupted! The reviews are generally fairly accurate. Okay, some bedrooms are small, the decorations a little tired and it is next to a building site. The breakfasts are fantastic and the position is really convenient. If youâ€™re here for a few days to see Istanbul, you shouldnâ€™t be spending time in the hotel anyway, so the minor niggles are really unimportant. Our thanks to the reception staff, especially Ahmed the bell-boy and Borca (?) of customer services. Both of them were charming, friendly, spoke good English and went out of their way to help. The staff all tried to help everyone stranded by the volcano and contributed by making phone calls to airlines and tour operators as well as arranging additional nights accommodation, transfers etc. The free wifi was a bonus, as was use of the hotel computer, for rearranging travel. We booked through lastminute.com but wonâ€™t do so again due to their complete lack of customer care while we were away. We will, however, go back to Istanbul and would definitely stay at the Ipek Palas again.

Reviews.Title: “ipek palas”
Reviews.Author: liaqat
Reviews.Content: me and my wife travelled to istnbul on the 12th april 2010 ....until the 17th ipek palas is great the rooms are small but clean and nice,,, emuk or emik lol was great as a staff member, service was brillaint and food was good,, over all had a great time.. would reccomend it 2 any1 for sure,,,

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned, attractive and clean, lovely breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: sukage
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night break at Ipek Palas was very much enjoyed. It's an attractively decorated hotel with small but spotless rooms and good quality beds. All facilities worked properly (TV, hair-dryer, phones, safe and internet access). Showers were hot and powerful. Only one small grumble - our rooms had no drawers, only a wardrobe. Breakfasts were wonderful. If you can't find something you like there, you must be very hard indeed to please. Ipek Palas is perfectly situated so you can walk at normal pace to The Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace and Harems, the Aquaducts and to museums all in 10-15 minutes. The Grand Bazaar is 15-20 minutes walk. The tram is 5 minutes away and the waterfront less than 10 minutes. Ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to explore old istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DnG_2009
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel sets the expectation for the rest of the hotel, and when walking into your room you are not dissapointed as it is a really pretty hotel. The rooms are clean and well presented also very comfortable and a good size room. Service is fantastic with staff always friendly and happy to answer any questions you may have, we asked staff for suggestions on best places to head out and for entertainment etc and they were always more than happy to provide recommendations which turned out to be great. Breakfast was nice with a great selection of hot and cold food to choose from, the view from the dining room is amazing and a nice way to start your day with a beautiful view of istanbul. Location wise it is only a short walk from all the major tourist attractions of istanbul, it is also close to the ferry boats if you were wanting to head to other parts of istanbul. overall this was in my opinion a very nice hotel i cannot fault it in any way, and i would definately be heading back to ipek palas for my next trip to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Form your own opinion........this is a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: DevonFlurry
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night break here with lastminute.com in January for a Friday-Monday stay in March.I'd read the reviews but always read between the line as some people do love to moan! Much better than I expected, I asked for a room facing away from the building works at check in and we got one,slept well as always take ear plugs when I travel to cities. Room very clean, cleaned well every morning and nothing disappeared from out of our room. Room cleaners always smiley & happy. Bell boys and reception staff more than helpful and especially the young lad in the restaurant. Great breakfast & enough coffee to keep us walking all over Istanbul until at least 3-4pm before we need to rest. Central location for the old city and best parts of Istanbul. Tips before you go, Do book an airport transfer via Power Tour at 10 euros each way. Do get a good pocket guide as it makes cutting through all the back streets a must! Don't get lots of currency in the UK as you'll get a better rate from the million cash points in the city. Go to Tokapi Palace for 9am start as by 11am it's rammed full of large tourist groups. Don't take a Bosphorus tour at 35 euros, go down and take a local tour from the LEFT side of Galata bridge at 9 lira, not even Â£4 each for the same tour. Do take a turkish bath at Cagaloglu Hamami for 40 euros/80 lira for a complete bath service & massage as it is amzing and a must do! and its 5 mins from the hotel. Do go to the Islamic & Turkish art museum and the Bascilia Cistern. Do go to the Egyptian Spice Bazaar next to the New Mosque by Galata Bridge as it's much more fun & better value than the Garnd Bazaar. The best stall at the spice bazaar is No 49 UYGUN KIMYA, these guys are great & I went back 3 times, they'll do you a good deal if you but the most the 1st time you visit, your follow up purchases wil then be for peanuts! Do eat at Sarnic www.sarnicrestaurant.com it's in a deep cistern (like Bascalia), the food is amazing, the waiters brilliant and the ambience a true delight. Great culture city, lovely people, crazy, noisey , exciting and unforgetable...will go again for more!

Reviews.Title: “lots of good points and a few bad”
Reviews.Author: Turkeylover61
Reviews.Content: We booked through lastminute.com mystery hotel deal .We stayed for 8 nights. Check in was simple and friendly and nice welcome drink. It was a bit strange having a porter coming with us to our room, and he was explaining everything, but after 2 hours stuck in traffic on way from airport and being turfed off the bus a long way from the ferry port in the pouring rain, which had gone right through our cases, we just wanted to get our wet clothes out ! He was just doing his job though I suppose. I think the whole bellboy thing is a bit pretentious and was trying to make the hotel appear a lot posher than it actually is. The view from our window was horrible, but they cant help that., there was a building being renovated and it became quite amusing watching them fill a lorry with rubble using a small spade. The bed was a very small double and the duvet wasnt wide enough. The mattress was really uncomfortable and basically worn out. None of the room doors seem to shut first time so we found we were regularly disturbed by people banging doors trying to get them to close. Getting in and out of the tiny shower was tricky, good job we're no bigger! The wireless internet didn't work on our floor after the first couple of days, we did report it but it remained not working, but theres 2 computers in the reception so although a bit annoying wasnt the end of the world. The room was very small and not much storage space and not many tv channels, and for some reason the speech and lip synch was completely out on all channels. We would have liked to have had an occasional drink in the bar, but the bar area was freezing cold, and rarely occupied, probably because of the cold. On the positive side, the room was cleaned daily, bedding and towels changed regularly, all the staff very friendly and the breakfast was very good, with lots of choice Location was perfect even with all the building work being done Overall for the price we paid we were very happy, however it really isn't 4 star and people shouldn't go expecting it to be. We would have been very disappointed if we had paid the prices advertised at reception. After 15 years visiting Turkey we are very aware that their star rating is very different to ours, but friendliness and atmosphere usually make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for if you shop smartly!”
Reviews.Author: I-veritas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ipek Palas for 4 nights having got a good deal at lastminute.com on a "top secret hotel" - I'd googled the description whilst booking and convinced myself that this was another hotel entirely. The hotel kindly arranged transport for me from the airport which I'm grateful for because even though the hotel is very close to the station, it would have been a nightmare trying to navigate the city streets otherwise (the hotel is in a backstreet and seems to be surrounded by construction sites). First impressions were good; the reception area was what one would expect for a 4 star hotel and I was offered a welcome drink and some useful local advice although I detected an element of promoting the services of local tour operators. I did feel somewhat irritated that the hotel porter insisted on accompanying me to the room to give me "important information" - ie how to use the minibar, order room service and switch on the TV, completely unnecessary. The room I was guided to was indeed a single as expected, but was incredibly small and the damp smell from the bathroom was immediately obvious. As soon as the porter left me I asked reception to upgrade me - not because of the room size but the bathroom which I did not even enter - which they did obligingly. The next room was marginally larger with a 3/4 size double bed but was furnished to the same standard as the previous, "faded opulence" would be a flattering description and shabby more accurate. The room was however very clean and when I eventually went to bed that evening I was surprised at how comfortable the bed was. However you can hear every sound in adjoining bedrooms - the laminate flooring contributed to this - and also interestingly all bathroom activity related to room ABOVE you! The simple explanation for this was a grid-like celing in the bathroom allowing all the pipework (including the sewer drain from the toilet ) to be both visible and audible. The external construction and sounds from the mosques were also evident during the day and night and the room could get uncomfortably hot without any means of adjusting the temperature other than opening a window. The bathroom was spacious enough with the exception of the shower which was 2'x2' max. This would have made it impossible for anyone with a BMI>30 to use, and I also struggled with this because of my height. With no shelf in the shower, my precariously balanced shampoo and conditioner fell to the bottom and was difficlut to retrieve without physically stopping the shower and opening the corner doors - any tall person would have difficulty in bending down to reach the shower tray within the small space. The shower itself was very powerful but the overhead bracket did not hold the shower in position properly. Breakfast was included in the price and was plentiful but not particularly tasty. Much of it was processed, no fresh fruit but fresh tomatoes and cucumber were available daily, as were olives , cheeses, meats, boiled eggs and a couple of hot dishes which varied daily. Fresh OJ is squuezed to order and charged extra. There was also a huge selection of carbs on offer (breads in various guises although nothing with bits in it that a northern European might relish), cereals were limited to generic cornflakes and a chocolate puff offering designed to appeal to children. I found myself enjoying the cornflakes and the people watching. LMDC calls the hotel "very nice" and based on the standard of the reception area I would agree, however the rooms are of variable quality. A quick scan of the fire exit route tells you all you need to know about room sizes - but be warned that x05 on any given floor is always the tiniest and x06 the most spacious. Later in the week I noticed that the larger rooms were furnished better. I am used to staying in much better hotels and have to say that I didn't feel particularly safe in the hotel at first because of it's location and standard of accomodation, and resolved to spend that first afternoon securing an alternative. The room did however have a safe which gave me some confidence and I then realised quickly that day that old Sultanhamet is a maze, most hotels are also located in what appear to be unmarked alleyways regardless of the standard of hotel. It's just the way it is in the old part of the city, handy for the main historic sites and safe for single females but presents huge hazzards to those with mobilty restrictions because of the poor condition if some of the streets. Like Istanbul, the Ipek Palas Hotel is an acquired taste and to my amazement grew on me. I can't complain for the price I paid but that would certainly not have been the 90Euro pn single room rate the hotel advertises at reception. IMO a hotel should offer a certain standard of environmental comfort to be awarded 4* rather than because of a mini-bar, for example. However, overall I got a good deal and had a fine time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Ipec Palace”
Reviews.Author: Waytotush
Reviews.Content: Few things I liked the most abt this hotel was very good reception area, Nice friendly staff, Cleanliness and nice breakfast in the morning time..Te staff was really helpful..I was visiting Istanbul very first time and almost had 2 buisness meetings fixed everyday during my stay(that was for 7 days). The reception staff really guided me in such a nice manner so that I could sane lot of money and time..They also provided me airport drop facility on last day..Room was clean and well decorated..so as bathrooms..Internet connectivity was very good..so overall it was very enjoyable stay at Ipec Palace and I would definetly like to stay ere once again during my next trip...!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central, however opposite a construction site.”
Reviews.Author: Missblue30
Reviews.Content: Reception looked like a four star, the rest of the hotel 3 at best. When we arrived at checking we were told that our card was declined, not looking at the paperwork properly, they dismissed us and sent us to another nearby hotel. Because of my husband was not having any of it, we went back to the hotel and asked them to check it again. Well it was their fault we had the reservation all that time, after all the misunderstanding resolved. A friendly porter on his first day at the job apologising, took us to our room, just to find a very small room with a double bed and the view well, very disappointing, a massive hole in the ground with lots of noise during the day, that didn't bother us as we was out all day, however at night there was this monotonous noise of generators all night long. Even though the windows were double glazed. Not a very peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ankiara
Reviews.Content: Ipek Palace looks really good from the outside. Really pretty and nice reception. First problem is that it's surrounded by 2 building sites at the moment, and they are very noticiable. But we didn't think much about it because they can't control their enviroment. The problems started after we checked in and went into the hotel. We had the 6th floor, but the real 6th floor is for the restaurant, so it's like an annex that feels like another building that was added after (we could glance some of what we thought would be the "nice" rooms and they were even smaller and looking the same way than ours) The corridor had badly folded rugs that are a serious hazard (I can trip on flat floors!) but we thought they were cleaning. We later learned that it wasn't the case. The doors of the rooms have a big space on the upper and lower sides, making it very easy to hear anything from the rooms next door, and there was very apparent plaster behind the radiator and under the window. The toiletries were laughable (ear buds, a shower cap and a smal bottle of shower gel) and they were never replenished. There was not even a single shelve in the shower and the doors wouldn't close properly. And the towels were changed only if they were obviously dirty (like with make up or stuff like that).
