They had tried to make the walls pretty with some nice wallpaper. Shame one strip was in one direction and the other one upside down. No tea/coffee making facilities and only one single plug in the whole room that you have to share with the TV and the mini bar (another thing that was never replenished and we had to buy our cokes in the shop around the corner). And we are 99.5% sure our bed sheets were not changed in the 5 days we were there. These are just some of the reasons that come to my mind (if you go, pay attention to the wallpaper in the restaurant, it's legendary) but there were more. If you want a great location (that's true), a reasonably clean place and hot water, this is a good place, but it doesn't deserve the 4 stars. I've been to 3 stars hotels better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: southcoasts
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, well decorated and clean. The hotel is in the old town and perfect for sightseeing being near the main attractions. Breakfast on the top floor with fine views was very good. As the hotel is partially a conversion of an old building, the doors are not sound proofed and it can be a little noisy. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great value for money - rooms are tiny!”
Reviews.Author: Amykron
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We were given a tiny room with a tiny double bed (lucky we are both quite skinny) and a window looking out to a brick wall - we were not very impressed. The TV only has about 3 channels in English. The breakfast was good and it was nice to go up and see out a real window! However the rooms were clean and the bathroom was large (pity they didn't make it a bit smaller and the room bigger!). The hotel also failed to deliver everything described in their website - in this case a kettle - a small thing but they should not purport to provide facilities if they do not actually provide them. I wouldn't mention it but the reception did not actually believe me when I stated this to them, and it required me to actually show them their webpage where the kettle was indeed promised - the customer certainly is not always right according to the hotel staff! I think you would feel very cheated if you payed the full 120 euro rate that is stated at the reception!

Reviews.Title: “The best service and the best value for money we've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: prunavipek
Reviews.Content: We first arrnaged our stay by e-mail and phone from Spain, subsequently making three changes. The helpful service was excellent. We arrived at the hotel in snow and ice at 3am and were again welcomed with smiles and instant assistance. This pattern was repeated throughout our week-long stay, in day-time by the girls at the reception desk and the "bell-hop", but also by the night-time reception, the room staff, the restaurant staff, a computer "fundi" and the management. (Indeed, 'smiling helpfulness' was the theme throughout Istanbul, from the shoe-shine man, the bus and metro staff, to restaurateurs, stall-holders and shopkeepers.) The hotel had given us winter reduced rates, yet when we moved rooms twice (first because of building works across the road, then because of a dangerous leak) we were given the best rooms in the hotel at no increase in price, despite our offering to pay more. We would recommend the Ipek Palas to anyone visiting Istanbul, and we ourselves will certainly stay there again. We will send photos shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Centrally-Located, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: UrbanTeacher
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Ipek Palas. We had a twin room. The room was small, but very clean and comfortable. The street was relatively quiet, so there wasn't a problem with noise. The breakfast was fantastic, and the restaurant had an amazing view of the Marmara. Since we had arrived in late afternoon/early evening, this was the first day view we had and it was breathtaking! The staff were generally friendly and helpful. A computer with Internet access was available for free, which was really nice to have. The hotel provides free slippers, which you can take with you. I still have mine. There was a safe in the room as well, and a hair dryer. In addition, the hotel is very centrally located, it was five minutes from the waterfront and tram stop at Eminonu, a ten-minute walk to Ayasofya, and 15 minutes from the Galata Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, basic, clean and simple!”
Reviews.Author: Sofeena
Reviews.Content: Having found this hotel through last minute.com, it appeared to be an excellent package with BA flights from London. Last minute claims it to be a 4 star hotel, reality is it's a 3 star at best! The location is superb within walking distance to all the sights (sultanahmet) and restaurants, spice bazaar etc.. However, despite being clean and the service being prompt and friendly, the hotel has only basic amenities. The rooms are very small and the shower cubicle would be a nightmare for anyone over 5ft 7! Construction is also taking place opposite which didn't bother us too much as we were up and out early but is worth considering. Breakfast was included but again very simple and mediterranean - nothing to shout about!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, friendly staff, good food, but noisy 24 hour building site next door!”
Reviews.Author: sunshineEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, friendly staff, they even let us into our room early with no extra charge and upgraded it too. Helpful staff. Rooms decorated very romantically, we had an extra room with sofa, it was very pretty. Only negative was that there was a very noisy building site next door and you could hear lorries, diggers all night. The Mosque is close and you also hear the prayer callings at various times of the day, sometimes quite early. We booked the hotel recommended transfer to take us on our return journey to airport and it was an hour late and we ended up missing our plane so we wouldn't recommend booking the transfer, but other than that, it was a nice hotel, and Istanbul is a city full of chram and charcater with lots of hustle and bustle and lots of history too. You should check out the turkish baths, it is quite an experience but a good one! Food excellent in Turkey also!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, welcoming staff, magnificent views from restaurant”
Reviews.Author: eleanor055
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter and I have just returned from a weekend trip to Istanbul, where we stayed at the Ipek Palas hotel. We had a wonderful time in this great city, enhanced by the satisfaction we felt with our hotel. The Ipek Palas is perfectly located for visiting the Topkapi Palace, the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. It is also very close to the Eminonu dock area, and is surrounded by a plethora of good restaurants. It is within easy walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazaar and the Arasta Bazaar. Our rooms weren't palatial, but more than adequate, and the showers were superb! However, the best thing about this hotel is the staff. Very pleasant, helpful and welcoming. The restaurant manager in particular was great, and this ,combined with the scrumptious and massive breakfast buffet and the amazing views, made the IP a hotel we would definitely return to again and again. Just a slight word of warning..... my son had a single room and it was very, very small, but having said that, if you're there for the sightseeing and don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room (and what a waste that would be!) it would be perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay & well recommended”
Reviews.Author: KhanLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife & I celebrated our anniversary by staying at Ipek Palas as a gift from our children. We had a wonderful time, staff hospitality was excellent and I would recommend it to anyone. The hotel was modern, beautiful and conveniently located in the heart of Istambul with very polite food and lovely food. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean...fantastic”
Reviews.Author: talora
Reviews.Content: very comfortable and clean hotel in sirkeci. most of the sightseeings are very close to walk. the personal is very kind and the breakfast is delicious! we`ll visit the hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “location location location, small room!”
Reviews.Author: CanveyLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked very lush in the pictures advertised by the hotel website. The rooms were extremely small and basic. The bathroom was very smelly and i had to hold my breath on several occasions. Every morning our sleep was disturbed by the chairs being dragged in the breakfast room above. The view from the breakfast room was breath taking but the breakfast was repitative, appalling and crowded at times. We didn't eat in the restaurant but generally we found food in Istanbul, not to our acquired taste. The location for this hotel is excellent, all the main tourist attractions are walking distance and public transport. The staff at the reception were not friendly and didn't provide a good service. We visited a place called Balat and this gave an insight to local life. I would recommend this area if your into culture and architect. Great place to take snap shots. We stayed for 7 nights but i recon 5 nights would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A 4* HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LaPatiperra
Reviews.Content: ..and far from it. Just came back from a trip to Istanbul and was highly disappointed by this hotel. The room we booked through the 'secret hotel' system on lastminute turned out to be a tiny 'shoebox' with a "double bed" of 1.20 m and 30 cm around it to walk around, and therefore you are forced to sleep touching the radiator on the wall. In terms of decor, it was far below the standards of other real 4* hotels. Do not be fooled by their tacky pictures on the website. Although you will find tacky from the frontdesk 'bell boy' to the manager's shiny grey suit. I just want to warn anyone going there that unless you are spending a certain amount the 'small double bedroom' is simple a sardines' can. This is at the most a 2.5* hotel and 4* wannabe. No shampoo nor toothbrush provided in case you need it. Just shower gel. Oh yes and some sleepers. Make sure to not let any water bottle around in the room or they may well accuse you of drinking from the mini bar even if you did not even open it. Only positive point: the view from the restaurant floor at breakfast. Food was just regular. OH!: THERE IS A SERIOUS BUILDING SITE NEXT TO IT CURRENTLY AND THEY WORK UNTIL MIDNIGHT! FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ManiJain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Sultanahmet area and near to tram station. the breakfast is very good and restaurent have a grat sea view. But the room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: joeoc2002
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. Perfect location close to all the sites and within steps to the Metro stop. The hotel and my room were both immaculate. The staff was great. The value (in terms of $ spent) was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “clean and nice hotel, polite stuff”
Reviews.Author: birbey
Reviews.Content: i liked this hote, clean room, clean bed, clean bathroom, good breakfast,polite stuff,and this hotel situated in old city near the station and there is near many restaraunts, it is very convinient. if i wil go istanbu, i will stay i ipek palace:)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ipeck palas”
Reviews.Author: Doutora-Bayard
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Beautiful position, you can go almost every where by feet (S.Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar, even Galata tower if you like to walk). The restaurant has a great view over Bosphorus. I cannot say anything about the dinner because I decided to have dinner in other part of the city, but the breakfast is great: you have a lot of fresh things and a lot of choice. The rooms are really clean, some rooms are small (I saw a room for one person) but others are simply great. My room was very beautiful and big, and I booked through an internet site. The staff of the hotel is really nice and helpful. They have made my stay in Istanbul unforgettable. In my opinion itâ€™s a very good hotel, if I come back to Istanbul, I will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: old_fat_man_62
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul a few times before this time to show it off to my wife. The hotel is lovely. Plush chaises longues, chandeliers, marble staircases, doormen in red jackets. The staff couldn't be friendlier and the manager is a great guy. All the staff are wonderful - happy, polite, friendly, smiley. We had a new year's party in the hotel - live music, dancing, a belly dancer - I must say it was the best new year I've had since I can't remember when. You are 5 minutes from 2 tram stops, 10 minute walk from Ayasofiya and Sultanahmet Mosque, Topkapi Palce and the Archaeological Museum (Troy and stuff!!) 10 minutes from Sirceci station and Eminonu ferry port, 40 minutes from Ataturk airport and in a street full of bars, cafe and restaurants (though the food in the hotel is good) Loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful and friendly staff, particularly in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MaxiEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the hotel. Hotel within easy walking distance of Blue Mosque,Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, etc. Easy to find way around. Hotel itself was comfortable but the room we had (101) is right beside where the service staff congregate to sort out the linen. They would talk loudly together, so very noisy from just before 8am and can be noisy until 10pm in the evening. Only other gripe about the hotel is the radiator in the bathroom was not working which meant that if we closed the door to the bathroom area to try and shut out the noise from the staff, the bathroom became very cold. Did report it three times but did not get fixed. The room itself was clean. warm and just big enough for the three of us. The reception from the TV was very poor so not watchable but we were not in the room much so not really a problem. There is a free safe in the room and a fridge. The staff were very helpful, particulalry in the restaurant where the restaurant manager, Ertugrul and the waiter, Emin, could not do enough for you. They certainly went beyond what would normally be expected. We had an evening meal in the restaurant which was very tasty, plentiful and cheap! Breakfast was good - yoghurts, fruit salad, eggs, a variety of breads, cheeses, ham, cereal, etc. There is cherry juice squash or water along with the coffee and tea but if you want freshly squeezed orange juice or pomegrante juice (lovely) it is 5 turkish lira extra. Went to the Grand Bazaar which, compared to other shops in Istanbul, can be more expensive. The spice (Egyptian) Bazaar is where you can get spices, teas, turkish delight, shawls, oils and perfumes galore. The Artisan Bazaar was a more civilised area, more sedate. Some lovely jewellery there. Be prepared to barter. Plenty to do and see and easy to get around without going on tours.

Reviews.Title: “3 star”
Reviews.Author: sloughboy
Reviews.Content: stayed in this place when i couldnt afford any better. admittedly it was a last minute booking. central location, run down building but location is what i went for. service was good I have to say and personalised enough for me to be happy with. rooms were a bit shabby but like i say, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “i have enjoyed my vacation in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul25
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is great! We had a wonderful time in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is verry good, we walked in a few minutes to some of the greatest sights of Istanbul. The hotel was clean, nice people, breackfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Getting better and better”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul-freak
Reviews.Content: It was the 5th time that i have stay at Ipek palas. The service is very good, very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are little bit on the small side, but everything is very clean. (This is for me the most important of anything) About a month i will go again. I have already booked.

Reviews.Title: “This is your average no frills hotel in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: WhirldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights while visiting Istanbul. Istanbul is expensive and you're just not going to get a lot for your money. Our room was very small, with two twin beds. The TV in the room is from the ancient past, as are the furnishings in this hotel. The room was sparsely furnished. In addition, our room was very noisy even though it faced a small side street. Thank goodness I had earplugs. We also slept with the windows open one night and I was bitten all over by mosquitoes, although my friend was unscathed (I was closest to the window). There was one computer available for guests, but there was usually always someone waiting. The location is fine, although it is a 15-20 minute walk to the main tourist areas (Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar). However, it only a 5 minute walk to the Sirkeci train and light rail station. This made going to Istiklal very convenient in the evenings. Istanbul's light rail is great, and I highly recommend that you take advantage of the light rail and the ferries. On the Sunday we were there, they had a 10K race through the city and they closed the light rail. We were going to Dolmabahce Palace so we ended up taking the ferry to the Asia side, then another ferry to the north. Don't pay for a cruise on the Bosphorous, when you can take the ferry for TL1.50. The breakfast offered was a weak point. Although it looks like a lot of food, upon closer inspection, it's not very appetizing. There are cereals and breads, but the eggs were very runny. I did not eat very much breakfast. If I go to Turkey again, I would look for another hotel. Not that there was anything wrong with this hotel, I just think I could do better. It could use a lot more charm, although when we checked out, we were given very heavy plaques with the blue evil eye in the center as a parting gift.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ipek Palas”
Reviews.Author: Arifeign
Reviews.Content: Good service and friendly staff. Located within walking distance from Sultanahmet, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, the Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmet Mosque) as well as Eminonu Ferry Terminal (For your Bosphorus Cruise). Good food at its restaurant located at the top floor of the hotel and particularly friendly Banquet Manager Mr Ertugrul, who gave good advise on what to see in Istanbul. Superb wi-fi connectivity. Ask the reception counter for its network SSID No.

Reviews.Title: “nice and happy days in ipek palace . from ayla akar”
Reviews.Author: ayladogan
Reviews.Content: i saw ipek palace before internet. And check from net it look so fresh and nice . And then we flied to ataturk airport . the hotel transfer meet in airport so friendly and nice . we came to hotel where location is so good for all whereÂ´. we have good nights and days this hotel. and i have to say hotel personels so nice for example recepcionist fatih balci and hause keeper fatma . i say to fatih balci 4 all things- because he is so nice and helper personel. who halped about all things abaout istanbul . he funny and so clever personel. if i came again istanbul i il stay in this hotel . i like where..

Reviews.Title: “Positives massively outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: d_scart
Reviews.Content: Yes, as others have said, the rooms are on the small side and there's a big hole at the back with, it seems, 24 hr working. Our room was 211, directly overlooking the hole. This didn't bother us as we live on a main road in London and are used to noise, in fact, find it soothing in a funny sort of way (many people growing up in noisy environments will say the same). However, on the positive side, the rooms are clean and well-decorated as are the public areas. The staff are friendly, and speak good English, contrary to what one reviewer said (perhpas they had agency staff in that week!). The location can't be beaten - it's virtually on the tram route thrugh the old city and all the main sights are easily reached on foot or by tram. We paid Â£245 each for four nights B&B flying out of LHR with BA. Top value.

Reviews.Title: “everything is nice except....”
Reviews.Author: kareemos
Reviews.Content: everything is nice except the A/C and the room. the staff were friendly, excellent location, the food wasnt bad either. they gave us a terrible room, with a view to the inner plumbs, and the A/c didnt have any cool air to give, it was suffocating. as for the internet, i didnt have my laptop with me, but there was one computer in the lobby that everybody uses, and always occupied

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient service, well located.”
Reviews.Author: claudeBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We were offered a drink on arrival, our room was for 3, myself and my 2 grown up children. Although it was a little cramped for 3, we did manage OK. For the price we paid it was fine. We were given a bowl of beautiful fruit for my birthday, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is taken in the rooftop retaurant, with lovely views. All in all, a good hotel, well situated, and good value for money. I would certainly revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Size DOES matter!”
Reviews.Author: Billericayman
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5 day break in Istanbul about 6 weeks before travelling, through lastminute, and choosing to upgrade from a small double to a standard double room. Our flight having been delayed by more than 2 hours due to needing to land in Munich to off load an ill passenger, we arrived at the Ipek Palas in the early hours of the 19th October. We were shown to our room (612) which would have been acceptable for one person, but for a couple far too small. The bed was small, and space in the room so tight that we had to pile out bags up on a little table in front of the door in order to enable us to get to the bathroom without tripping over any obstacles! As we were booked in for 5 nights, we decided that we would ask for a room change. Our request was handled exceptionally well; we were just asked to pack up our belongings and told that our bags would be moved to our new room by the time we returned. The reception staff were at all times friendly, polite and helpful. Sure enough, we were relocated to room 110, which was about three times the size of the previous room, it was spotlessly clean, with bed linen and towels changed daily. There was construction work going on outside, but it did not disturb us - we were also disturbed by the call from the nearby mosque at 6.20am every day, but you have to accept that it's part of the culture when you go to a foreign country. We would agree that the breakfast is really good, there is an excellent selection on offer every morning. Freshly squeezed juice is extra, but you don't have to have it! The views from the restaurant are spectacular. The hotel is extremely well located for sightseeing, restaurants etc. Would we recommend it? Yes - with one caveat - if you don't like the room, ask to change. So I have now added that to my former pre-requisites of cleanliness, comfort and safety, something that most men and all women already knew - size does matter!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel: read between the lines.”
Reviews.Author: FieldofClothofGold
Reviews.Content: The trouble with most reviews is that you know little of the reviewer. If your teenage brother described the hotel he and his mates stayed in as â€˜brilliantâ€™ would you rush out to book? Similarly, would you accept the negative comments regarding a 3 star hotel, from a person who normally stays in 5 star accommodation? I canâ€™t believe reviewers who describe this hotel as â€˜great.â€™ The best review of this hotel was written by â€˜anahatac â€˜. At best this hotel is a basic 3 star hotel, best for a 2 or 3 night stay for those wishing to keep costs low. Read the reviews and see the common threads re room size, etc. My wife and I travelled with friends. On arrival we were told that due to over-booking there was a problem. Would we share a family room? This room had a small double bed, a single bed and a single sofa bed. The room was small and there was a shared bathroom (no bath). We refused as we had paid for two standard (not small) rooms. Our friendsâ€™ room was a reasonable size: our room and our double bed were very small. The air conditioning (room 633) was broken. They tried to repair the problem but to no avail. With the window opened (it was hot and stuffy in the room) we were woken up each night. Although there is a narrow street outside the hotel it is a busy road throughout the day, evening and throughout the night. The hotel rooms are arranged on two sides. One faces the road where there is a great deal of building work (a cement lorry delivered at one oâ€™clock in the morning!): the other faces a building site. The noise at night was dreadful and it continuously woke us up. Unfortunately my wife and I were bitten whilst we slept (six or seven bites each over the three nights). From past experience we suspected bed bugs! The hotel staff spoke little or no English: we had no useful information from the reception staff: they could not give us any directions, recommend restaurants or provide a local map. This contrasts poorly with most other hotels that we have stayed in. Good points? A great location for all the sights and close to the tram: nice, but quiet bar: safe area: good local restaurants, good breakfast and a great view from the restaurant at day and at night. So donâ€™t book here for the quality of the room, unless you get one pictured on their website! Maybe we were unlucky: the other reviews appear to agree that the rooms are small, basic and do not have a good view. Other local hotels will probably fail to come up with a decent view, but they may have better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in the vibrant city....”
Reviews.Author: Kule Dude
Reviews.Content: Booked flight and hotel deal with Lastminute.com and flex into Sabhia Gocken at the start of Ramadan - private transfer took two and a half hours - but only forty minutes for the return later in the week. Friendly reception at the hotel, with clean room - albeit in the attic with sloping ceilings. Excellent views from the Restaurant, but it took two lifts to get there! One down to Reception and then another up to the fifth floor. Good choice at breakfast, although an extra charge for orange juice. Trams run very near to the hotel and all the major attractions are within walking distance - Topkapi/Blue Mosque/Hagia Sofia/Ferry Boats/Sunken Palace/Spice Market etc.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandPoochie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for a 5 night stay in Istanbul. When we arrived we were met with warm welcomes and were brought to our room. We were disappointed with the room as it was so small but were told to request another room the following day as the hotel was booked up that night. True to their word the following day we were given an upgrade to a beautiful room and the staff were happy to accomodate us. Apart from our displeasure with the initial room it really was a delightful stay, not to mention really good value too. The staff were nothing but Frienly and accomodating and the hotel was in an excellent location for sight seeing. When leaving the staff gave us a present which was very kind. i highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “BEST in the area...”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLER1905
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Ipek Palas with my girlfriend in September. It was my girlfriend`s first visit to Istanbul. We enjoyed staying at Ipek Palas. Service was great. Staff was very friendly and they were available when we needed them. I LOVED their newly decorated rooms. (cappadocia theme is the winner) Roof top restaurant was a great treat. Watching the Bosphorus from the top floor was amazing. Food was delicious. Overall we enjoyed every second of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but don't expect 4-stars”
Reviews.Author: travelbuzz09
Reviews.Content: I stayed between 12/10 and 16/10 on a deal booked through lastminute. Lets get the the bad bits out of the way - the description of the deal was "small 4-star double" on latsminte. The reality was box room with no bathtub, no tea making facilities, no tissue paper and no bottles of lotion and shower cap etc - stuff you would expect from a 4-star room. The phone in the room is the worst - it's hung on the wall next to the bed, and your ear. Apart from the this, everything else is very good. The rooms are clean, the staff friendly although their English is not very fluent. The location is great, convenient for getting around and close to the major sights, with lots of good local eataries around the corner. The breakfast is worth getting up early for too, delicious spread and great views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jendick
Reviews.Content: Great location for this perfectly adequate 3star hotel. The roof top restaurant provided wonderful views of the Bosporus and Golden Horne whilst one was enjoying a good and varied buffet breakfast. My wife and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “CORRECT BUSINESS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CologneHanks
Reviews.Content: culture and business is combined.I could really find what I needed.free wifi, fax, secreterial services...and helpful staff I will definitely recommend it to my colleagues

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but small room, broken air-con, facing construction site.”
Reviews.Author: anahatac
Reviews.Content: Good location, but the pictures give the impression that the rooms are a lot bigger than reality. Everything is clean, but the air-conditioning start to play up every evening. Staff were extremely unhelpful and refused to admit to the problems. Despite promises to change rooms the next day and to get engineer to resolve the problems, nothing at all was done, not even an apology. The worst thing is that the hotel faces a construction site at the moment which had works going on at random time, so when we were faced with no air-con, we had to open the window, and yes - there were loud noises from the building site downstairs. Good job I had ear plugs with me. Staff were not that helpful in terms of giving advice about travelling around and were not interested in advising us any other ways to go to the airport, except for booking their private car hire.

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMEND ipek palas”
Reviews.Author: shahisultan
Reviews.Content: 04/10/09 Whislt on my vacation, I spent a week at Ipek Palas in room 306. I have to say it has been one of the most pleasant experiences for me so far! It was pleasure for me to have resided at your hotel for I felt extremely well looked after. The 6 days I spent at Ipek Palas were enjoyable and most pleasurable. Your hospitality had been proven to be very beneficial for myself. I am unable to express how impressed I am with the generosity of staff members and the respect they had demonstrated towards us. The atmosphere as a whole was marvellous. I have experienced great satisfaction with the standard and quality of services I had been provided with. My reservation was made with lastminute.com, I was a little anxious as to what to expect before arriving at the hotel, however once there I cannot stress how welcoming and professional staff members and others were towards us. The check in was a very pleasant experience, no hassle what so ever. I would recommend others to stay at Ipek Palas as the location of the hotel is fab, the cleanliness of the room was up to scratch, I would rate the service of the hotel, restaurant and astounding breakfast 100%. I look forward to arranging another trip to Turkey soon! S Sultan - Wales- UK

Reviews.Title: “comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sentur
Reviews.Content: I have been there for business. The rooms has free wifi and working desk. The hotel is close to many business centers. The room was cleaner then a 5 star hotel. The satff was very friendly and helpful. Thank you meral and the guys.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: pennylane12
Reviews.Content: It is conveniently located in sultanahmet - only a few steps away from Haiga Sophia, The Topkapi Palace and The Egyptian Bazar which suited us well. When we wanted to have a break from this tourist area, the tram stops near the hotel (Sirkeci Station) and can whisk you over the galata bridge to Beyolu, where the more lively street Istiklal Caddesi is situated. Eminonu is about 5 minutes walk away for trips along the bosphorus. The staff are kind and responded promptly to any questions we had. If you enjoy eating in the hotel, the panorama from the restruant is not to be missed. Good value for money and very handy for first timers in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: politetim
Reviews.Content: Looks really nice and has very friendly staff, good location, especially for local restaurants. rooms are nice and clean but ours was quite small as advertised, they were very clean and not a problem. this hotel was the best value for money we could find.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you`re staying in the Golden Horn”
Reviews.Author: alintravel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Perfect location for the Golden Horn, you`ve got a lot around!!! I absolutely loved it. Helpful and professional staff, super clean room and great shower, I didn`t try the restaurant and the breakfast, but there`s a great view from there.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY GOOD PLACE TO STAY.GREAT AMBIENCE.”
Reviews.Author: behzadmulla
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel with everything just a walking distance away.very friendly and helpful staff.Breakfast has lots of variety of food to select from with a great view of Bosphorous.Room's are nice and cosy.I will certainly love to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lahoski
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com at a very reasonable rate (about Â£40 per night for the small room) The room was indeed small but very clean and with enough space. The bathroom was a good size with powerful shower. The breakfast was excellent. A great choice and wonderful view over the city. The staff, both at the restaurant and in the hotel in general were fantastic - very helpful yet discrete. The reason for giving this hotel 4 and not 5 was that it was a bit noisy. Our room did overlook the metro works that others have commented on. Although this was not too loud and didn't disturb us, you can hear it from the room and they seemed to work at all hours of the day and night, (this of course, isn't really the fault of the hotel) which some (especially if you have paid full price) may not be happy with. Overall we would recommend this hotel - it is in a great location and a perfect base from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel I strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: amina-ning
Reviews.Content: Spent our tiem in Istanbul at Ipek Palas hotel. It was our first visit and we strongly recommend this hotel to others planing a trip to this city. Hotel is located in the best possible location on the old side of Istanbul. Near to everything: shopping, restaurant, tram/train, Sulthanamet etc. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We will surely choose this hotel again for our next trip to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel which to make reference in the days of visit to the ancient part of the city of Istambul.”
Reviews.Author: paciasole
Reviews.Content: We went only few day's but we could enjoy our permanence without thoughts, with the safety to owe us to worry only of as to spend the days knowing to be in the hands of kind and able personnel. The hotel is new and pleasant, with elegant and fascinating finishes, the room restaurant to the sixth floor grants a generous vision of the numerous minarets and of the sea. In total a pleasant hotel which to make reference in the days of visit to the ancient part of the city of Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Warm atmosphere and delicious sightseing from breakfast restaurant”
Reviews.Author: pandabear_pec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the old town, in a renovating area, so you might find streets around not perfectly clean and well managed, anyway this is the real Istanbul, with old shops and street restaurants and cats and men sharing the same small corners Warm atmosphere and delicious sightseing from breakfast restaurant will repay everything anyway Furthermore the hotel is at walking distance from Aya Sofia and other monuments, Galata bridge and tram/boats stop

Reviews.Title: “Superb, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: zedjay55
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my two teenage children. The room was good and bathroom was clean and modern. There was a wide range of selection for breakfast. Room service was good and the staff friendly. Ideal location and all the main attractions are at walking distance. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for family as wel for solo visit”
Reviews.Author: Armani33
Reviews.Content: this year we visited Ipek Palas for the second time. Last year we visited this hotel to. The rooms are very clean whit good design. Family rooms are comfortable. The view from the breakfast restaurant (6th floor) is perfect. Between the Galata bridge, the famous mosks, FSM bridge etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BenIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! Go through the description of the hotel and all you will read is true. Very friendly staff, good value for money, great location, comfortable beds. The receptionist kindly accepted to open the hotel bar for us at 3 in the morning to have a last drink before going to bed! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as the pictures portray!”
Reviews.Author: Zedelle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 4 nights here, the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was more than adequate but...........room 116 which we were allocated left a lot to be desired. The room was very small, the bed was extremely uncomfortable, the bathroom was a misnomer as it would be more accurately described as a bathcupboard. We were unable to sit comfortably on the loo as it was positioned too close to the shower. The toilet cistern leaked all over the floor. The noise from an adjacent building site woke us up very early each morning and the air con did not function as well as it might. Nevertheless, despite all of this, we did thoroughly enjoy our stay in this wonderful, vibrant city and the hotel was ideally situated for easy access to the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, convenient location and fantastic breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: LondonRosePetal
Reviews.Content: Would certainly recommend this hotel. Ideal location between the Golden Horn and the attractions of Sultanahmet. Short, fun and very cheap tram ride to the Grand Bazaar. The highlight was the buffet breakfast with a panoramic view. We had a very friendly welcome from the helpful staff and the rooms were clean and comfortable (lovely air conditioning).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Basekin
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, the staff is very helpfull and the rooms are very clean. The breakfest is also very well. A good place to stay when you visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly welcoming hotel ,which enhanced our holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Musafir786haddington
Reviews.Content: This is truely a well run hotel,with helpful and friendly staff attending to all your needs.My daughters and I marvelled at the nice decor of our triple room.The room was adequately spacious and well equipped with all the creature comforts for a comfortable and enjoyable stay .The rooms were cleaned to a high standard.The rooftop eating experience was an added bonus.The view over looking the Bhospherous was like a picturesque moving postcard .The activity of the ships sailing was amaizing to watch over breakfast! I would highly recommend this hotel for the reasons mentioned above ,as well as the great location.It is so close to all the tourist sights ,supermarket.tram station the ferry port and great bazaars. I hope to return next summer with many of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position in Sultanahmet, nice small room”
Reviews.Author: sultan_fabio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and comfortable. Great position to visit the old city and very near to the tram stop. The only drawback was the room that was actually slightly too small for two people, although very cheap!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mayamo
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for seven nights and found it very welcoming. we were put on two seperate floors on the first day and the double bed had a light switch on the side which we had read in a review already. we asked for a change and they put us all on the same floor and changed our room and seemed very appologetic.room service and cleanlinss was very good and water pressure in the shower was out of this world. there is so much to see in istanbul that we hardly stayed in the hotel apart from sleeping at night.i suggest people who like to spend some time in the hotel should pay extra money(i dont think its much)and go for bigger room with city view etc.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: Cintiacarmo
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the hotel and the staff are very helpfull.The location is fantastic near many atractions.

Reviews.Title: “Big difference in room's Dont trust the picture on the web”
Reviews.Author: Tobias83
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a nice location and easy to find. But there's a construction yard right next to the hotel, and make some noise during the night :-( We booked a normal room, and got a very small room with very bad view. Then we complained, and they help us find another room the next day. Got a lovely room with its own style. Please make sure you order a room with a theme. Breakfast is okay and dinner okay, but there is plenty of places to go, just outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: sham29
Reviews.Content: we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Ipek Palas; the staff were very friendly, the buffet was amazing...and best of all...the house keeping was absolutely out of this world. the rooms were kept fresh and clean...and bed coveres were changed every morning without fail. the only downside was that the 'city view' was more of a roadworks and wall view....none the less, there was a nice rooftop resturant from where breakfast was served...the views of the city and surrounding sea were breathtaking. overall...we will definately be returning to this hotel very soon on our next visit. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “great location and very welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mangaroo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight, we were very tired but excellently welcomed. We were impressed by the location and couldn't help noticing the convenience of everything, i.e. restaurant, shops and great transport within reach. We are both city people so we automatically loved and blended into the buzzy atomosphere...Istanbul is definitely lively and sleepless. A great place for 5 day holiday. The people of Istanbul are really friendly. The rooms are rather small BUT the view makes up for this...stunning. The decor of the rooms are classic and basic and very clean. The room service and waiter were excellent and I made friends with 'Muslim' who was very helpful and friendly. His approach was somewhat down to earth and we quickly took a liking to him. The breakfast has a variety of foods on other...lots of choice and even caters for the health concious. Once again, the staff were excellent and very attentive. You will definitely enjoy your stay at Ipek Palas. Sam and Jodie.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in very central location”
Reviews.Author: vintagebutterfly
Reviews.Content: Ive just returned from a five night stay at Hotel Ipek Palace, Istanbul and can report a mostly pleasant stay. As having been mentioned in previous reviews, think carefully about choosing a room here as the standard doubles are very small and you can probably find a larger room for the same price elsewhere. We went for Ipek Palace having been offered a very good last minute rate and knowing we wouldnt be spending too much time in our room anyway. So how small you ask? Very small. And the bathroom was tiny, it was an amusing experience fitting in and out of the minature shower cubicle each day. The double bed was a manageable size but very hard in places and sagging in others, we left with a few aches and pains at the end of our stay! Apart from the size, the room was very clean and furnishings all in good condition. There was a powerful air conditioning system and television. We had clean towels and fresh sheets every day without fail. The decor of the rest of the hotel is a pretty good standard, with a nice lobby and the top floor restaurant has a brilliant view out across the bosphorus. The breakfast (included in price) had a wide variety to choose from, savory and sweet, something to keep adults and even fussy children happy. Definitely fill up on the breakfast before embarking on your adventures around Istanbul. I wouldnt advice eating in the restaurant for other meals however as the food was not up to standard, and you can find much better for the same price or less elsewhere. The hotel staff were nice and spoke reasonable english. We were welcomed with a complimentary drink and discussed our stay with the hotel manager who was very helpful. Be warned that the hotel is currently next to a building site and during the daytime quite a lot of drilling can be heard from across the road, so siestas at the hotel might not be too relaxing. Also the hotel is in the thick of it, so traffic noise can be heard quite easily. This stops around 6pm though, so as long as you stay out all day, you'll miss it. All in all, an ok stay for a good price, but we probably wouldnt stay there again. The real plus side for this hotel is the location, very close walking distance to all the main attractions, but next time we might go for the more modern area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SudokuKing
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our first impressions were not the best. Having arrived at 11 o'clock at night we found the rooms allocated were very small (despite having paid an extra to the tour company) and one had a broken air conditioner. The next day things looked a lot better as we were moved to bigger and better rooms. The location of the hotel is good being within walking distance of most of the major sites and the ferries and tram to go further. Unfortunately there is now a building site for a new Metro station next door (which didn't make much noise) and the hotel is on a well used cut through for traffic. Nearby restaurants were good and reasonably priced. The staff were great - always helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a reasonable buffet with good views across Istanbul from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful as well as Hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: braggconstructionltd
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is exceptional and its location is very convenient. The service is excellent. Food is delicious as there is a wide variety of different foods to eat. We were hoping for a 4 star quality Hotel in Istanbul and that is what we got! Enjoyed every moment, will never forget this trip and wouldn't mind going back to the Hotel again. Many thanks to the freindly staff at the Hotel Ipek Palas, Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: bardez
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul, and we didn't really have much of an idea where to book. Having read the reviews on here, it sounded a good choice! We used the hotel 'taxi' service from the airport and were really glad!! Would never have found it otherwise without a lot of 'frustration'. I went with my husband for our wedding anniversary. We'd booked a superior room, and upon check-in asked for a smoking room. They said there'd try and find one. Which they did. But I think it was one of the 'standard' rooms in the main building, lower floor. All I can say is, do NOT accept one of these rooms. Hell, they are TINY. I wouldn't have been over-impressed if I was staying on my own in that room. We went to reception, and pointed out there was no way were stopping in that room, and credit to the guy on reception, he found us another room, which I think must have been the 'newer' part of the hotel. It was brilliant. However not a smoking room... The location is amazing. 10min walk (following the tram tracks) to the palace, on to the Blue Mosque. The other way, 10min and you by the water, and a different way, the Grand Bazaarâ€¦ And LOADS of cafes, restaurants close by for eating. As it was out anniversary, we were able to arrange a champagne breakfast delivered to the room on the day, and the hotel were more than happy to do this :-) Breakfast itself was good with a wide selection. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We also used the hotel â€˜taxiâ€™ service to go back to the hotel, and it was prompt and efficient. For 25 Euro upon arrival, 20 Euro to departures (Iâ€™m guessing the difference was to cover car parking fees). I would strongly recommend itâ€¦ especially for arrival into Istanbulâ€¦ Would we stop here again? Certainly. But NOT in one of the tiny rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location but air con inadequate”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie-england
Reviews.Content: The Ipek Palas Hotel is in a good location only a couple of streets away from the ferries and the Galata Bridge and about 10 mins walk from the Blue Mosque, grand bazaar and spice bazaar. The hotel has wonderful chandeliers, good decoration and a free computer with internet access (thought you have to share with the rest of the hotel so may have to wait at times) The train station is only one street away so dont bother with a taxi if you arrive at Sirkeci Train Station - just ask directions - everyone is very helpfull. Taxi's are cheap and plentyfull - it only cost us 30tl from the airport to the hotel and was a 30 minute ride. All have meters, and taxi's do not expect tips but are very grateful if you do. The breakfast which is on the top floor of the hotel has good views of the city and gives a good selection of food for guests - the fruit salad was wonderful - but you had to pay 5tl for freshly squeezed orange juice- lots of other places sold it for much less. The air conditioning though was inadequate as Istanbul was very hot in July as you can imagine - and retreating to your room to cool down was not an option. The air con did work but was inadequate - we kept it on all night but the room still did not cool down at all. We would have loved to go back to our room more often out of the heat, but only the reception area had adequate air conditioning - even the bar area was too hot to relax and drink - so we went to other bars instead. Overall our hotel was good and well worth what we paid for our weeks holiday - aftercare is not good though as I left something in our room and emailed the hotel twice asking them if they found my item - and to date I still have not received a response, so I dont suppose that will be returned to me. I am happy to pay postage if they would return it, but with no response what can you do?? The lady manger was always in reception every morning at her desk on her computer thought, so I dont know why she is not replying? It would have been nice to have the option of hiring a portable fan in our room - after all its worth paying extra to be comfortable - perhaps the hotel will bear this in mind - its lovely to go back to your room and relax - all we could do was take a cool shower 4-5 times a day to cool down. We would recommend this hotel though

Reviews.Title: “Lovely cosy hotel with amazing location”
Reviews.Author: akzah
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well placed to see the blue mosque, palace and sophia mosque and other destinations are just a walk away. No need for taxis to see the main sites. Station and food outlets are just next door as well as shisha places all for good prices. Rooms as mentioned by others are small, I stayed in a double and had it to my first and was comfie but probally not suited for two people. Otherwise its clean and everything was in working order. The best service is from the hotel staff at the desk who are very helpfull and friendly. Yes they are building a tube station next door but its not loud. All things said its a lovely hotel and good breakfast to start the day. Not to mention free wifi in all rooms which is a great plus!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: stevewEssex_England
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff who speak english. Small rooms, but clean and with modern shower rooms. Convienient location a few minutes walk from sirceki tram stop. About 45 mins from main airport using metro and tram,

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional level of service”
Reviews.Author: Rubyxxx
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel while we were being allocated our room, my friend and I were offered complimentary drinks. The room was a nice size, but very little wardrobe space for two women - but we managed. There was a very new modern electronic safe for all our cash and passports. The bathroom was very small but it was adequate. The room also had a mini bar which we used to store our own drinks, however the prices of the drinks were not too high. So it wonâ€™t add too much to the final bill. The breakfast area is located on the 6th floor and from some tables you are able to see the Bhosphorous. There is a good selection of food available â€“ but I recommend you take your own tea bags if you like a good cup of tea. The Ipek is in Sultanament and literally all places of interest are 10 -15 minutes away. It was really safe to walk around the area in the evening as there are many street cafes where locals and tourists are sat drinking tea or coffee. On one side of the hotel, we were in room 107 there is lots of building work taking place across the road. As we arrived on Saturday it was not noisy â€“ but on Monday night we hardly slept as the construction workers were there until 1.30am. When we mentioned the situation to Ahmet at reception, he immediately arranged for us to move room and also provided a member of staff to take our cases to the new room which was on the other side of the hotel. From this room there was absolutely no sound of the building works. Everyone at the hotel has a smile and are willing to assist you in all matters. For a 3 star hotel it was 5 star service with a smile. I would highly recommend the hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdviserLondon
Reviews.Content: Very hospitable and warm welcoming as you enter the hotel check in. We truely felt a real sense of warm welcoming with a smile as soon as we walked into the hotel - after our - not so long flight but our never ending journey from the Airport to the hotel. Credit goes to all the staff to include Reception, Porters, Dinning Staff, Bar Staff, House Keeping, and must not forget RESERVATIONS, to name a few, who also helped with directions to get to the hotel from Airport. I shall definitely be recommending HOTEL IPEK PALAS to all my friends who visits Istanbul. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “felt living in Ottoman Empire times”
Reviews.Author: flzyildirim
Reviews.Content: We were given a room named Topkapi Palace. It was designed like the Sultan's room in the palace. There was a big Sultan's bed with a beatiful netting..(cbinlik....turkish) There was a show glass where different ottoman types of pieces were put. Also a big sofa where we could have a rest. Also there were alot of documents and photos about the palace in the rooms. We learned alot about it before visiting. They said if we reserved the room before 15 day we could get a free entrance for the palace. We went alot of different rest. but the food quality were not good as compared to the hotels top floor restaurant.The prices were economic. The breakfast was wonderful with the nice old city and bosphorus view restaurant. We did not get such different ,elegant service in our life.Thank you hotel Ipek Palas staff thanks for everything............we will not forget our memories forever............

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were clean and the staff helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: locationvisitor
Reviews.Content: The greate advantage of this hotel is it's location. Conveniently close to the city's main attractions, the Spice Bazaar is within an easy walk. I recommend the Bosphorus ferry trip which is just a short walk to the waterfront. The Blue Mosque and the Underground Cistern are a short trip on the tram, costing only 1.5 TL for a token. My room was rather small but adequate, and was provided with satellite television, including English speaking BBC World Service. The hotel itself, the rooms and the bathrooms were all clean and well maintained. The hotel has a restaurant and bar, and the staff were helpful and friendly. I really enjoyed my holiday and this hotel certainly contributed towards the memories that I brought back. For the price I paid, this is excellent value, and I would recommend anyone to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice and friendly staff'”
Reviews.Author: Gumby88
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ipek Palas Hotel is nice and centrally located. The staff are very helpful and the rooms were nice and clean. The hotel is within walking distance(10-15mins) to most of the main attraction - Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Egypt Spice markets. The hotel quite close to the tram station(Serkeci) which is convenient if you decide to take the inexpensive route from the Ataturk airport(approx 40mins-55mins). Its not a direct route so you have to interchange at Zeytinburnu. The breakfast buffet had a great selection of hot and cold foods(more cold than hot) and has pretty decent views of the Bosporous river. The only down side to it are that the rooms were are quite small and the walls, depending on your room, may not have the appropriate noise dampening materials. So you may hear your neighbours coughs, sneezing or conversation. Also, the call to prayer which happens regularly over the course of the day and night can also be heard, so if you're a light sleeper, maybe look at bringing a set of ear plugs as this will improve your stay. If you able to see pass the minor down side, the hotel is worth the stay for the service, location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location ideal, staff fantastic”
Reviews.Author: WestEalingite
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel tired and hot after the journey and were greeted by warm smiles, cold drinks, and helpfulness from the staff which was wall-to wall until we left. Nothing was too much trouble for them. When the sole came off my shoe and I asked about where to buy super glue, within 10 minutes, somebody arrived at the room door with glue and fixed the shoe for me. Breakfast on the top floor overlooking the city and the Bosphorous was lovely - lots of fresh fruit and bread, yoghourts, coffee etc. And as always, helpful friendly staff. Location is within 10-15 walk of major sites - Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia among others. Tram stop to port for ferries and other places is a 7 minute walk. The room was compact but perfectly adequate. We had a wonderful stay and would like to say a big thank you to all the staff who made it so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: m_mayhs
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is nice. Easy to get to places of attraction and also to other parts of town by tram. Helpful staff. They all speak good English too. Lovely lounge area. The only down side is the room size. Very small and hardly any room to walk about. Felt claustrophobic. But if you are spending very little time in hotel, it should be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and hospitality - an excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: KalleStockholm
Reviews.Content: The Ipek Palas Hotel is located in the very center of the historical Istanbul (the old town, Sultanahmet), where you find the famous monuments/buildings, such as Haghia Sophia, The Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, to name but a few, nearly just around the corner. You even find good restaurants in the area. The communications are excellent. There's a tram station at Sirkeci about 200 meters from the hotel, that connects you to almost any part in the city. Over all, I think this hotel is an excellent choice for your stay in Instanbul. Great staff and very good service. By the way, there is a little surprise when you visit the restaurant for breakfast, lunch or dinner on the top floor. A magnificent view over Istanbul through panorama windows. Best Regards From Sweden

Reviews.Title: “good choise”
Reviews.Author: newguest_9
Reviews.Content: As for this hotel, I must say that it was a good choice. It is a nice hotel with family atmosphere.I stayed at hotel in the end of April 2009. . I think, that it is very good hotel under quite reasonable price.An ideal location - 5 minutes walking distance to historical places of Istanbul. Bedrooms and bathrooms are not so big, but comfortable, very clean with fresh towels every day. Free wireless Internet is also a nice touch. Breakfast is included up on a roof terrace with an incredible view to Bosporus . Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel, even if the area is a bit tacky”
Reviews.Author: Saniman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (which we found on the net) for a four day city break at the beginning of June. We chose it because it appeared to be, and is, only a few minutes walk away from all the major sights of the city such as Topkapi, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar etc. I must admit our spirits sank a little as we approached the hotel, situated as it is in a rather run down street, with empty buildings and redevelopment taking place at the side and rear. However, we were very pleasantly surprised on entering the large and pleasant reception area from our taxi, which had been efficiently arranged by the hotel to fetch us from the airport. After the formalities and cool complimentary cocktail (non alcoholic) hit the spot. We were shown to our room by a helpful porter who spoke passable English. (In fact all the staff seemed quite at home in English) Our room was adequately sized with a reasonable bathroom, but one minor criticism is the the lack of drawer space - actually none - so every thing had to be left in the bags or put on a single shelf in the wardrobe. Our room looked out onto the street, and we were worried about the level of traffic noise - Turkish drivers seem to have the horn in use the moment there is any hold-up longer than 5 seconds! However the double glazing and air conditioning were both reasonably efficient and caused us no real trouble. I think the quality and range of the breakfast buffet is the best I have ever seen in a hotel of this price. We used the enclosed top floor terrace style restaurant only once for dinner during our visit and have no complaints there either. All the staff were very pleasant and friendly and arranged a trip by boat on the Bosphorous for us - no trouble at all. I think this hotel is good value for money, and I would certainly use it again. I expect all the area will be tidied up in the not too distant future and this hotel will be more appropriately situated to reflect its quality.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: turingoo
Reviews.Content: Our friends advised this hotel and we were surprised that it was incredibly comfortable .We will definetely advise to other friends. A samily guest relation, clean room excellent breakfast, great location...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Chilton_Traveller
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Ipek Palas for three nights. On arrival we were shown to room 304. Having just peeped inside a room which was being cleaned, were were quite excited about seeing our room. Unfortunately, it was such a tiny room, we found it difficult to walk around at the same time! The plumbing in the bathroom also smelled. The hotel staff kindly offered to move us. Our new room, 626, was much better. Plenty of space to move around, a shower that didn't smell of sulphor, no noise from the road below and the BBC World Service (this wasn't available in room 304, for some reason!). The 6th floor restaurant has a great view of the Bosphorus, and a fairly good breakfast. The hotel also has a bar, which we didn't find until the second day. They also offer free internet access. The staff were very helpful. We couldn't have asked for a better location. Just a short walk to the main sights...Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Basilica Cistern. On a good run, only 20 minutes to Ataturk Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller66
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short trip to Istanbul. We chose Ipek Palas as we only had a few days and wanted to make the most of our time and the hotels location allowed us to do this. All the major sites in the old town were within easy walking distance. We arrived late and were given room 618 which felt like converted office space but was very clean. It was however very noisy as it wan't double glassed and was on a low floor, so one to avoid. The next morning when we mentioned this to the receptionist he changed our room immediatly and had our bags moved to a new room. This room, in the same part of the building but on a higher floor was ideal, bright, double glazed, well decorated and again very clean. All enquiries to reception were dealt with in a friendly efficient way. The breakfast room on the top floor had great views across roof tops to the Bosphorus. The public transport in Istanbul was excellent so those looking to go further afield shouldn't hesitate to use the modern trams and busses. You can buy a travel pass (Akbil Electronic Transit Pass) that can be used by several people at one time on boats, buses, metro and trams. You set up it up initially for what ever amount you wish and then it can ve topped up with more money again if needed. They are available at several points throughout the city. The nearest location to purchase an Akbil Pass if staying at Ipek Palas is at the bus station opposite the Spice Bizarre. It makes life so much easier than always looking for change.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great area for sightseeing - very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kiwifern
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is great. Its in a prime location to all the main attractions, has wonderful hotel staff and is clean and nicely presented. I would stay there again. On arrival they offer you a drink and escort you to your room. We had booked a family room with 2 yr old, and after a bit of confusion on what a 'family room' was, we did end up with what we expected which was a 2 bedroom room as had been discussed on the phone. For others booking the family room I would ring prior to booking to ensure you understand what it is you will be paying for as the other rooms shown were a single room with multiple beds. All very nice, but not offering the separate space for us and our child. Breakfasts were decent with a good selection of food - very similar to what you find in most reasonable hotels across europe. We also had dinner one night and found it reasonable in price in comparison to restaurants around the area and it was really tasty food also, so don't hesitate to eat there. Everyone was fabulous with our boy and he was known by all the staff on departure and was spoilt rotten. We were offered a shared taxi from the airport for 60 Euro for 10 people but opted for the metro and got there for 7 lira for my husband and I instead. Its a really easy tram/metro ride from the airport; clean, efficient and you arrive within 5 minutes walk from the hotel (sirkeci stop). Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poeshke
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend in a twin room, and generally we were very happy with our choice. We got a very good deal on the room, and the location of the hotel cannot be faulted - it is in walking distance of the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. There is a tram on the corner of the street as well. The room we stayed in had a rather original decor (it was meant to resemble the ice sheets in Pammukale), but the bathroom was modern and new. The beds were comfortable. the walls are not very thick so we did hear other people coming and going, but it was not much of a problem overall. The breakfast buffet was rather good, and the breakfast room overlooks the new town. the staff was very helpful and spoke good English. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a weekend break if you want to be somewhere central, and you do not need lavish luxury. Well worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice polite staff and perfect position”
Reviews.Author: T1melord
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay last weekend. We were picked up from the airport with no problem and the staff were all eager to help. Perfect positioning for sighseeing

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amusingdestinations
Reviews.Content: We got the family suite which was small but really comfortable. The room was decorated like a room in an old castle. The bathroom was really tiny but clean and doable. It is about a 10 min walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, plus near shopping and many cafes and restaurants. The view from the restaurant during breakfast is absolutely beautiful. I will stay at this hotel the next time I am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: girlsfromholland
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth time i was in Istanbul and the third time in Ipek Palas. I was there with friends (total three girls) and i can only say that the hotel is getting better, cleaner and also more professional. It is in the near of eminonu and also in the near of the most important mosques. If i must compare it with other hotels in Istanbul i can say that Ipek Palas is cheaper and also cleaner. It is a great hotel with clean rooms, tasty breakfast, warm-hearted staff, good service. I will absolutely recommend it to everybody!!! Don`t think, act and you will see that is a good hotel........

Reviews.Title: “fab location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: hediho
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 3 nites at this hotel the location is excellent for blue mosque and all other tourists areas, first room was a bit small but hotel moved us on second nite. Staff very helpful and all round excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Great location and public areas but room very small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: ifyouwillnothaveme
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, near the Sultanhamet sights and on a street of nice restaurants. The beautiful lobby is a lovely place to sit for a drink in the evening, a class above the rest of the hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful, bar is nice but expensive, great sea view from the top floor restaurant. It has free wifi internet and a computer available. However - our 5th floor room was very small and noisy - we could hear chairs moving in the restaurant, talking in the corridors, and all our neighbours' activities (!). The hotel is next door to a mosque which is ideal if you like a 5am wakeup call every morning. The bathroom plumbing was smelly. We did enjoy our time there though!

Reviews.Title: “First week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: maydaymusic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first week of our 3 months holidays in Istanbul at this hotel. The bathroom is.......small & bad! Tile is falling out too. Difficult to control the water. Bed is ...average.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated, comfortable and every member of staff friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: yoursplendidjourney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ipek Palas with my daughter, it was our first visit to Istanbul. Situated in the centre of Seraglio Point the hotel could not have been better situated for exploring the oldest quarters of Istanbul on foot, as well as a very short tram ride to Beyoglu. Our small bedroom and well fitted bathroom had airconditioning and was spotlessly clean. An excellent buffet breakfast with a wide choice of food was served in the roof top restaurant that has panoramic views of the Bosphorous and the Golden Horn. The manager and senior staff have good English and were easily contactable by e mail before our trip. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Although the bedrooms were not large, the public spaces are spacious with a bar, lounge and small area for internet use which is well used by guests.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Hotel in the Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Warrennash
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is an Outstanding Value located within blocks from all the sites in Istanbul. The Hotel is nice, But the service and staff is what makes this hotel. Ahmet did a great job in faciltating transporatation to the airport and other transporation needs. We had dry cleaning sent out and received the same day. The staff speaks adequate english and works very hard to make you feel at home. Excellent management. A good safe place for a first time traveler to turkey.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located and clean!”
Reviews.Author: TomandRascal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a central position. The room was very small but clean. They have a good buffet breakfast. The staff is really friendly and hospitable. We definitely reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “beutiful environment,wonderful staff,delicious breakfast,we will surely b back”
Reviews.Author: ZulfiDubai
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience,staying in such a nice hotel with central location to most sights of Istanbul,highly recommended,worth money

Reviews.Title: “Varying room quality, poor luggage security, noisy”
Reviews.Author: gkgl81
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Ipek Palas, and had a double room and a twim room between 4 of us. I booked after reading excellent reviews on Tripadvisor, but we are really quite disappointed. Mixed experience overall. The double room was tiny, and there was hardly any room to turn around in the crammed shower room. It was particularly noisy at night, as windows were single glazed and there was busy traffic passing the hotel. The closed doors left relatively a wide gap so the motion-activated light from the corridor outside shone through into the room as soon as someone walked past. Luckily we were able to switch to a different room, and the other room was better. Note that not all rooms look like the ones they show on the website! Don't expect too much from breakfast either, particularly if you are into western style breakfasts. Luggage security is pretty poor. We left our luggage with the hotel, there was no labelling system, and they just asked guests to identify their own luggages, in fact you don't have to give identification to prove that you are staying at the hotel - that's rather a lot of trust! Overall basic but clean. Location is really excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “We'll DEFINATELY stay here again”
Reviews.Author: impossible2impress
Reviews.Content: The experience was absolutely great right from the begining (when I started making a hotel booking via hotel web site) until I left to the airport (with complementary transportation from Ipek Palace). To be honest, I can't think of anything that did not satisfy my picky needs; 1. the hotel staff were very eager to assist in any way they could 2. the room was cleaned on a daily basis. Considering that I stayed in Ipek Palace during cold month - the room heater was working well, which made my sleep even better. 3. the breakfast was basic, but very delicious. In the evening, it was nice to have a glass of wine with fruit platter in the hotel restaurant on the 6th floor. Note: they have a good turkish wine selection. I would recomend this hotel to all the travellers: young couples, families, single travellers and etc. Special thanks to Mr.Muslum for always being there. See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: moncefFrance_Tunisie
Reviews.Content: good located hotel, near most famous places of Istanbul, staff available & nice, good breakfast with excellent view.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ipek Palas
